Con los 1.500 que solicita, lo invertirá para contratar peones y puedan ayudarle en sacar la maleza que crecen sobre sus plantaciones de cacao.
texts.en: Beatriz is 46 and married to Adrian, 48. Together they have a child who is in university. They live in their own home located in the Puerto Mayo town, in the Pichari district. From a very young age Beatriz has worked in agriculture, specifically in the cultivation of cocoa. However, when she started her family, her husband's economic support meant that she was able to acquire a small plot of land where they cultivated cocoa and coffee. With the passing of the years, they had their son Joel. This meant that Joel's dear father has had to sacrifice a lot for him, as Beatriz could not help out and occupied herself with the housework. As their son grew, she was able more and more to work and support her husband in the agricultural tasks. Thus she wants to open a store in which she can sell clothing. This will be her second loan from MFP, so she hopes for the support of each and every one of you in order to achieve her goals. She also promises to be punctual with the repayments of her quotas. With the money that she is requesting, she will invest in contracting labourers to help with the removal of the weeds that are growing in her cocoa fields.

loans.use: to contract labourers.

loans.name: Doris

texts.es: Doris tiene 46 años, está casada con cesar de 40 años. Juntos tienen 4 hijos y radican en la selva exótica de Pichari donde tienen su propia casa. Para Doris su único objetivo es salir adelante. Desde muy joven tuvo que trabajar mucho para poder ayudar a sus padres en el gasto familiar, es así que empezó vendiendo los productos que cosechaban sus padres logrando obtener su primer salario. Hoy tiene su propio terreno en donde siembra cacao, y esto es gracias por el apoyo de sus padres y las enseñanzas que lo dieron durante su adolescencia. Ahora lo que más prioriza es tener otro terreno agrícola para poder expandir la siembra de cacao. Sin embargo no deja de cumplir con las obligaciones de madre que tiene, es así que luego de realizar los quehaceres de la casa, ella junto a su esposo se enrumba a cultivar cacao sobre 5 hectáreas de terreno que posee. Este será su segundo crédito con MFP, por lo que espera el apoyo de cada uno de ustedes para que pueda intensificarse en la producción del cacao. Doris está feliz con todos los de su banco comunal, porque todos  son muy optimistas. Con los 1.500 soles que solicita, lo invertirá en el mantenimiento de su parcela de cacao.
texts.en:
Doris, 46, is married to Cesar, 40. They have four children and live in the exotic Pichari jungle where they have their own house.  Doris’s only objective is to get ahead. From a very young age she’s had to work hard to help her parents with family expenses.  She, therefore, started out selling products harvested by her parents.  

Today, she has her own field where she grows cocoa beans, thanks to the teachings and support she got from her parents during her youth.  Her main priority now is to have another field to expand her cocoa bean crops.  However, she does not fail to meet the responsibilities she has as a mother so, after doing her household chores, she and her husband go out to farm the cocoa beans she has planted on the 5 hectare field she owns.

This will be her second MFP loan so she hopes to have support from each one of you so that she can intensify her cocoa bean production.  Doris is happy with all her fellow communal bank members because they are all very optimistic.  She will use the requested 1500 new soles to care for her cocoa bean field.

loans.use: to hire field hands and to buy fertilizer for her cocoa been plants.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more party supplies.

loans.name: Béthania Fifondi

texts.fr:
Betania Fifondi est une femme âgée de 35 ans. Elle est célibataire. 
Betania Fifondi a travaillé comme revendeuse depuis 2008. Elle vend des œufs à son domicile. Elle achète les produits à Lomé.
Betania Fifondi a requis son troisième crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter 250 plateaux d'œufs.
texts.en:
Betania Fifondi is a 35 year old woman. She is unmarried.
Betania Fifondi has worked as a retailer  since 2008.She sells eggs at her home. She buys her produce at Lomé.
Betania Fifondi requests her third loan from WAGES in order to purchase 250 trays of eggs.

loans.use: purchase eggs

loans.name: Virgen Del Pilar Group

texts.es:
El comité Virgen del Pilar  se conformó gracias al esfuerzo de todas las miembros, ellas se encuentran en el 6 ciclo. Manifiestan que están felices, que trabajan forma conjunta y solidaria dentro del programa.
Todas ellas son mujeres jefas de familia, que luchan cada día por llevar a sus casas el pan de cada día. Luchan por el sustento de ellas mismas y la de sus hijos. Cada una disfruta de todo lo que hace y dicen que el programa las ha ayudado mucho a crecer, no solo económicamente, sino a nivel personal también.
La Sra. Mariana es comerciante, se dedica a la venta de ropas, sabanas, abrigos, y demás. Por medio de esto pudo salir adelante y cubrir sus necesidades económicas. Ella sueña con algún día poder tener un local donde promocionar sus mercaderías.
Ella solicita el credito para el abastecimiento de su stock de mercaderías,es decir para la compra de ropas de temporada, ya que con esta estación que entra recibe muchas demandas de clientes.
texts.en:
The Virgen del Pilar committee was formed thanks to the efforts of all the members.  They are in their sixth loan cycle.  The say that they are happy to be working together and supporting each other in the program.  

All of the members are female heads of household who struggle every day to take home the daily bread.  They struggle to sustain themselves and their children.  Each one enjoys everything she does and says that the program has helped her to grow a great deal, not only financially, but personally as well.  

Mariana is a businesswoman.  She sells clothing, sheets, coats, and other items.  Through this activity, she is able to succeed and cover her financial needs.  She dreams of someday having a shop where she may promote her merchandise.
  
She is requesting the loan for the supply of her stock merchandise as she knows that having a wider variety of merchandise will attract more customers.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for resale

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase more bales of used clothing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more clothing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more CDs.

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
El señor Julio es mototaxista, hace 5 años que trabaja en esta profesión, esta casado con la señora Elisa, tienen  3 hijos, la mayor se llama Rocio Elizabeth tiene 26 años ya esta casada, el segundo es David tiene 22 años, trabaja y estudia, y la tercera hija se llama Liz y tiene 15 años, esta estudiando en el colegio todavía.
El se define como un hombre muy trabajador que se siente uy orgulloso de lo que hace, ya que por medio de ese trabajo ha podido hacer estudiar a sus hijos y darles una vida digna y decorosa.
Su sueño es seguir trabajando para que de esa forma pueda invertir en otro negocio que siempre quiso poner con su señora que es un copetin.
El solicita el credito para la compra de repuestos para su moto taxi, el cual es el medio para su trabajo, sin lo cual no podria trabajar.
texts.en:
Señor Julio is a motorcycle taxi driver, he has been working in this field for 5 years.  He is married to Elisa, and they have three children.  The oldest is called Rocio Elizabeth, she is 26 years old and married; the second is David who is 22 years old, he works and studies; and the third child's name is Liz, she is 15 years old and is still studying at school.

He defines himself as a very hardworking man who feels proud of what he does, and through this work he has been able to make it possible for his children to study and gives them a decent and dignified life.

His dream is to continue working in this way so as to invest in another business he has always wanted to have with his wife, which is a fast food counter.

He is requesting the loan for the purchase of spare parts for his motorcycle taxi, which is the means for him to do his work.  Without this, he would not be able to work.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his motorcycle taxi.

loans.name: Monrovia Group

texts.en:
Hariet, who is in her early 30s, is married and has four children who go to school. 

She has had a fruits and vegetables business for three years now. She works from 9 a.m. to 6 p.m. daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be her third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase the business stock and also to renovate her working place, and she has paid back her loans successfully. 

She wants a loan to buy more fruits and vegetables. Her dream is to one day buy land for building a house of her own.

She will share this loan with her loan group, "Monrovia," which has a total of 16 members who will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

loans.use: To buy more fruits and vegetables to resell.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es: Yolanda tiene 48 años, está separado D. su esposo hace ya 12 años, con quien tuvo 5 hijos. Juntos viven en su casa propia, ubicada en el distrito D. Pichari. Yolanda D. joven siempre trabajó en las labranzas del campo junto a sus queridos padres, quienes le inculcaron ese espíritu D. emprendedora. Luego que se casase empezó en el negocio D. compra y venta D. maní, ajonjolí, que en aquellos tiempos eran rentables, sin embargo los agricultores dejaron D. producir estos productos  y ella con el capital que obtuvo decidió abrir una tienda dedicado a  la venta D. abarrotes que hasta hoy en día le es muy rentable. Parte del éxito que tiene en su actual negocio es el trato cordial que tiene hacía sus clientes, además que sus hijos la apoyan siempre. Este será su primer crédito con MFP por tanto espera el apoyo D. todos ustedes para que pueda implementar su negocio. Con los 1.000  soles que solicita, comprará más productos D. primera necesidad como sacos D. arroz, azúcar para implementar su tienda.
texts.en:
Yolanda is 48 years old.  Twelve years ago she separated from her husband, with whom she has 5 children. Together they live in their own home, located in the district of Pichari. 

Since she was young, Yolanda has worked tilling the fields together with her beloved parents, who instilled in her the spirit of entrepreneurship. Later, once she married, she started in the business of buying and selling peanuts and sesame seeds, which in those days were profitable.  However, farmers stopped growing these products, so with her capital she decided to open a store that sells groceries; even today it is very profitable. Part of the success she has had in her current business is due to the warm welcome she gives her customers; additionally it's because her children always support her. 

This is her first loan through MFP, therefore she hopes for the support of all of you so she can facilitate her business. With the 1,000 Soles requested, she will buy more staples such as sacks of rice and sugar to stock her store.

loans.use: to buy rice and sugar to stock her store.

loans.name: Las Emprendedoras Group

texts.es: El Banco D. Emprendimiento LAS EMPRENDEDORAS es un banco que ya está en su sexto ciclo y el Banco está conformado por 9 Integrantes 6 Mujeres y 3 Varones y las señoras se dedican al comercio y venta material escolar, confección y otros, y la Sra. OLGA es la presidenta del Banco y  tiene tres hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar y ella se dedica a la venta D. material escolar  hace bastante tiempo y con el préstamo  comprara material escolar D. diferentes variedades y aumento D. su capital D. trabajo  y D. esta forma mejorara sus ingresos, y su calidad D. vida, es una persona muy responsable con ganas D. superación agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
The entrepreneurs' bank "LAS EMPRENDEDORAS" is a bank that is now in its sixth lending cycle.  The Bank is maD. up of of nine members; six women and three men.  The women traD. and sell school supplies, clothing and other things.

Señora Olga is president of the bank and has three school-age children.  She has been selling school supplies for some time and with the loan, she will purchase different varieties of school supplies and increase her working capital.  In this way she will improve her income and quality of life.

She is a very responsible person with the desire to excel, and she is grateful to the institution for the support being offered.

loans.use: to buy a variety of school supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agrochemical products.

loans.name: Changamkeni Group

texts.en:
Angela, who is in her early 20s, is married and has a baby girl.  

She has been running a grocery store for three years now. She works from 7 a.m. to 10:30 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.  

This will be her fourth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to finish building her house and also to buy items that were missing from her grocery inventory. She has paid back all her loans successfully. 

She hopes for a loan to increase the grocery inventory. Her dream is to one day own a food shop.

She will share this loan with her loan group, "Changamkeni," which has a total of 15 members who will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

loans.use: To increase the grocery inventory.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy an electric saw.

loans.name: Elva Sonia

texts.es: La señora Elva tiene como principal actividad económica la venta de zapatillas en las ciudades de Oruro y Cochabamba, también en un puesto que tiene en anticrético en una muy concurrida, la Sra. Elva comenzó hace muchos años atrás con el comercio de ropa, luego se dedico a la administración de radiotaxis y ahora incursionó en la venta de zapatillas para adultos y para bebés, negocio en el cual le va muy bien, con mucho esfuerzo logró consolidar su capital, ahora solicita el crédito puesto que requiere incrementar su capital comprando zapatillas por mayor, para los meses posteriores en donde tiene mayores ingresos. Ella vive en casa de su esposo junto a sus hijos los mismos que están todavía estudiando. La señora es cliente de la institución desde el año 2006, trabajó primero en un banco de emprendimiento, pero por el tiempo limitado que tenía prefirió cambiar a crédito individual, todos estos años doña Elva demostró responsabilidad y puntualidad con sus pagos.
texts.en:
Elva's main business activity is selling sneakers in the cities of Oruro and Cochabamba.  She also sells from a stall that she rents in a very busy area.  Elva started out in business many years ago selling clothes.  She then worked running a radio taxi business and now she has started selling sneakers for adults and babies.  Her business is going very well and, with a lot of effort, she has managed to consolidate her capital. 

Elva is requesting a loan as she needs to increase her capital by purchasing sneakers wholesale for the coming months which is when she makes most income.  Elva lives in her husband's home together with her children who are in school.  She has been a client of our institution since 2006.  She used to work as a member of a community bank but, because of the limited time that she had, she preferred to switch to taking out individual loans.  Over the years, Elva has demonstrated responsibility and punctuality in making her loan repayments.

loans.use: to increase her capital, buying sneakers wholesale

loans.name: Bartazard

texts.fr:
Client de 45 ans, marie et pere de 3 enfants dont l'age varie entre 5 et 15 ans.En 2005 il ouvre un pressing pour laver les vetements hommes et femmes, ses revenus sont de 10.000 a 25.000 fr par jour.

A l'octroi de son pret, il va acheter des detergents de differents qualite, des sachets pour emballage, des douzaines des cintres et il est entrain d'epargner pour acheter un groupe electrogene de 3kv pour palier au probleme d'electricite.

Pour le futur il a l'intention d'ameliorer ses conditions de travail,et travailler plus qu'avant pour ouvrir un autre pressing plus moderne.
texts.en:
He is a 45 year old client who is married and father of 3 children who are between the ages of 5 and 15.In 2005 he opened a laundry for men and women’s clothes, his income is of 10.000 to 25.000 per day.

When he receives his loan he will buy different quality detergents , bags for wrapping  the clothes, dozens of clothes hangers and he is in the process of saving up to buy a 3kv generator to resolve the electricity  shortage.

In the future he aims to improve his working conditions and work more than before in order to open another, more modern laundry.

loans.use: purchase detergents of different quality,bags ,and dozens of clothes hangers.

loans.name: Johny Alexander

texts.es:
Con la ilusión de estabilizarse económicamente y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia conformada por su esposa y sus 2 hijos, desde hace tres años Johny Alexander decidió crear su propio negocio, comenzó vendiendo helados en un espacio que adecuó en la casa de su padre, y poco a poco a logrado comprar mas variedad de productos, lo que le ha permitido sacar adelante su negocio, gracias a su esfuerzo y al apoyo brindado por su esposa, esperan ir progresando día a día para finalmente tener una estabilidad económica con la cual darle a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida.

A sus 33 años de edad, el sueño de este emprendedor es llegar a tener su propio local en el que pueda ubicar su negocio, Johny trabaja diariamente de 8:00 a.m. a 9:30 p.m. con la motivación de tener un mejor futuro. 

Por ahora y para caminar hacia la materialización de su sueño, Johny necesita de un préstamo para comprar gran cantidad de surtido que le permita generar más utilidades y así mejorar la apariencia del negocio frente a la competencia.
texts.en:
Three years ago, in the hope of stabilizing his financial situation and improving his family's quality of life (his family consists of his wife and two children), Johny Alexander decided to set up his own business.  He started out selling frozen treats in a space that he created in his father's home.  He gradually managed to buy a wider range of products.  He has been able to get ahead in his business thanks to his efforts and the support provided by his wife.  The couple hope to make progress every day so that they can eventually achieve financial stability.  This will enable them to provide their children with a better quality of life.

At 33 years old, this entrepreneur's dream is to own his own premises in which he can locate his business.  Johny works every day, from 8.00am to 9.30pm, with the goal of enjoying a better future.

Right now, and with the goal of achieving his dream, Johny needs a loan to buy a large quantity of stock which will allow him to make more profits and thereby improve the appearance of his business with respect to the competition.

loans.use: to stock his business

loans.name: Maria Sonia

texts.es: La señora María atiende un kiosco surtido  la ubicación de su negocio se encuentra en  un lugar céntrico y muy conocido, el lugar en que se encuentra  su negocio es favorable es una zona concurrida por clientes por la demanda de sus productos; los predios de su negocio son propios por lo que tiene que habitar, para cuidarla ella habita y comercia en su negocio junto a su hijo es una persona madre soltera e  independiente  actualmente su única fuente de ingresos es  su negocio en su kiosco que se encuentra bien  surtida el dinero que se le otorga  es para la compra de productos para su kiosco, para surtir su kiosco, la señora es una persona dispuesta, responsable con muchas ganas de superación agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
María works in a kiosk stocked with a variety of merchandise, located in a central and popular area where the business attracts customers who look for her products.  The prices of the merchandise in her business are those needed to cover her living expenses and to manage the business, she lives and works  there with her son.  She is a single mother and independent and her only source of income is the kiosk.  It is well supplied and the money offered her will be used to buy products to stock the kiosk.  She is a responsible and take charge person with great appreciation for the institution that offered her the support.
.

loans.use: To buy a variety of products to stock her kiosk

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es: Elizabeth es natural de Chupaca, ahí vive con su esposo y su hijo en casa de sus padres. Desde hace 9 años se dedica a la agricultura, sembrando papa y alfalfa, pues son productos necesarios que le sirven de forraje para alimentar a sus cuyes, cuya granja lo tiene instalado en la propiedad de su padre. Además cría vacas en donde la leche que extrae la vende diariamente. Estos ingresos le sirven para poder sustentar su economía y también para invertir en su granja de cuyes. Se siente muy satisfecha de las actividades agrícolas que realiza, porque ha visto la forma de generarse ingresos mensuales como es el caso de alquilar campos ya cultivados de alfalfa, así como la venta de cuyes y de otros productos que produce como: maíz seco, papa. Su deseo es tener más terrenos para poder extender el cultivo de papa y tener una granja de animales más amplia. Es la novena oportunidad que tiene un crédito de manera grupal con MFP, en todo este tiempo de trabajo ha demostrado su responsabilidad en sus pagos, además  el dinero lo ha venido utilizando sabiamente para intensificarse en sus actividades agrícolas. Con el dinero que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de sacos de abono orgánico para sembrar zanahoria.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is from Chupaca.  She lives there with her husband and son in her parents' home.

For nine years, Elizabeth has worked in agriculture, growing potatoes and alfalfa.  These are products that she uses as fodder to feed her guinea pigs.  Her guinea pig farm is located on her father's property.  She also raises cows whose milk she sells on a daily basis.  This income helps her to support her family financially and also invest in her guinea pig farm.  She feels very happy with the agricultural work that she carries out as she has seen how to make a monthly income.  For example, she rents fields ready sown with alfalfa and also sells guinea pigs and other products that she produces such as dried corn and potatoes.

Elizabeth's wish is to own more land so that she can extend her potato crops and own a bigger animal farm.  This is the ninth time that she has taken out a loan as a member of a group through MFP.  Over the years, she has shown responsibility in making her repayments.  She has also used her money wisely to boost her agricultural business.  Elizabeth will use the money that she has requested to invest in buying sacks of organic fertilizers to sow her carrot crop.

loans.use: to buy sacks of organic fertilizers

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Revendeuse de pagnes, eau en bouteille, vins, Afi est mariée à un retraité et mère de 03 enfants. Elle sollicite ce crédit pour renforcer son activité. Elle a démarré en 2005 en s’approvisionnant à Lomé et en revendant au marché de Hédzranawoé. Elle désire voir ses enfants grandir dans de bonnes conditions.
texts.en: Afi is married to a retiree and is the mother of three children.  She sells pagnes (colorful West African cloth), bottled water and wine.  She is requesting this loan to expand her business.  She started her business in 2005, gets her supplies in Lomé and sells them at the Hédzranawoé market.  She wants to see her children grow up in prosperous circumstances.

loans.use: To buy pagnes, bottled water and wine

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es: Hilda es natural de Chupaca  y toda su vida ha radicado en su tierra natal, vive en su casa propia en compañía de su esposo y sus 3 hijos. Toda su vida ha estado ligada a las actividades agrícolas, y actualmente continua sembrando papa y maíz. Es así que parte de su vida la dedica a sus cultivos para que así la plaga de insectos no afecte su productividad. Por lo tanto debe tomar acciones concretas que la ayudarán a tener una buena producción y recuperación de la inversión que realizó durante la siembra. Parte de los herramientas que tiene es la de contar con equipos y una tractor así minimiza el costo de inversión que normalmente se realiza en esta etapa.  Ahora su mayor deseo es aumentar su producción e incursionar en la siembra de otros productos alimenticios. Ya son 6 veces que tiene un crédito con MFP de las cuales considera que aprendió bastante en la administración de sus ingresos, que hoy en día son más sólidos en su economía porque tiene a la mano los créditos de manera oportuna. En todo este tiempo ha demostrado ser puntual en sus pagos por lo que se le considera una persona de confianza. Con el dinero que solicita, comprará sacos de abono orgánico para poder sembrar zanahorias.
texts.en:
Hilda is from Chupaga and she’s lived her entire life where she was born.  She lives in her own house with her husband and three children.  All her life she’s been tied to farming and currently continues farming potatoes and corn.  She thus spends part of her life tending to her crops so that the insect blights won’t affect productivity.  Because of this, she has to take concrete steps that will help her attain a good harvest in order to recuperate the investment she made at the moment of planting.  Part of the tools she has is some equipment and a tractor which minimizes the cost of the investment normally made at this stage.  Now, her greatest wish is to increase production and to go into planting other food items.

She’s had six loans with MFP already and she feels that she learned how to administer her income with them.  Her income and economy are more solid nowadays because she has loans easily available.  In all this time she’s been punctual with her payments so she is considered to be a trustworthy person.  She will use the money she’s requesting to buy sacks of manure to be able to plant carrots.

loans.use: to buy sacks of manure.

loans.name: Mounira

texts.fr:
Mounira est une femme âgé(e) de 28 ans. Elle est mariée å un chauffeur. Elle a  03 enfants.
Mounira est revendeuse de céréales depuis 2001. Elle vend  au marché de N’kafu. Elle achète les produits à l’intérieur du pays. 
Mounira a requis son premier cycle crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des céréales.
texts.en: Mounira is a 28 year old woman.  She is married to a chauffeur.  She has three children.  Mounira has been re-selling fertilizers since 2001.  She sells at the N'kafu market.  She buys her products inside the country.  Mounira has requested her first loan cycle from WAGES in order to purchase fertilizers.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Juana es natural de Hualahoyo, vive en compañía de su esposo y sus 4 hijos en su casa propia. Toda su vida se ha dedicado al campo, que gracias a las enseñanzas que le dieron sus padres pudo valerse por sí misma en esta actividad. Cuando se casó,  ella y su esposo  forjaron con arduo trabajo su casa, para así proporcionarles bienestar a sus hijos. De esta manera ha logrado consolidar su actual negocio, que es la venta de animales, entre ellos la venta de vaca y toros, que al cabo de un tiempo luego que hayan logrado tener el peso exacto, son vendidos en la feria ganadera o en el camal que es donde recibe buenas ganancias. En adelante desea tener un establo donde pueda albergar más animales y así pueda crecer su capital de trabajo. Es una de las socias más comprometidas, por lo que ha optado solicitar un crédito con MFP, ya lleva dentro de su record 9 oportunidades de las cuales siempre ha demostrado ser puntual en sus pagos. En tanto ha invertido adecuadamente sus anteriores créditos por lo que ha venido creciendo de manera sostenida. Ahora invertirá el dinero que solicita en la compra de un toro.
texts.en: Juana is from Hualahoyo.  She lives with her husband and their four children in their own home.  She has worked in the countryside her whole life and thanks to what her parents taught her she has been able to take care of herself doing this.  When she married, she and her husband built their house with their hard work in order to give their children well-being.  In this way she has been able to form her current business which is the sale of animals, among others, the sale of cows and bulls which at the end of the time needed to reach a certain weight are sold in a livestock market or to a slaughterhouse where they receive good profits.  Looking forward, she would like to have a stable where she could house more animals and thus grow her working capital.  She is one of the most committed members as she has chosen to request a loan with MFP and already has nine opportunities on her record to show her ability to make punctual payments.  As such she has invested her past loans well and has been able to grow her business sustainably.  Now she will invest the money she is requesting in the purchase of a bull.

loans.use: to buy a bull.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es: Luisa tiene 58 años, radica actualmente con sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. Desde que nació, sus padres forjaron en ella el trabajo duro como es las tareas del campo. Ahora los terrenos que ha heredado, le sirvieron para generarse ingresos económicos que le ha ayudado para sostener a sus hijos, que hoy son personas  mayores y de bien. Es así que continua cultivando hortalizas como zanahoria, cebolla, espinacas, acelga y maíz, que los hace secar y desgranar vendiéndole al por mayor, siendo llevados a la ciudad de Lima para venderlos en un puesto de ventas que ha conseguido en la misma ciudad. Asimismo vende frutas, en dicho puesto que ya tiene 5 años de funcionamiento y le ha traído buenas ganancias que compensan el esfuerzo que ha realizado en la temporada de siembra y de cosecha. Siente gran satisfacción de haber logrado mejoras económicas por lo que desea seguir trabajando. Lleva vaR. años trabajando con MFP y es una de las integrantes que impulsa la unidad de su  grupo solidario, que con su responsabilidad se siente orgullosa y tiene más ánimos de continuar trabajando de esa manera. Con el crédito que solicita, le servirá para la compra de sacos de abono orgánico y también en la compra al por mayor de frutas para implementar su puesto de ventas.
texts.en:
Luisa is 58 years old.  She currently lives with her two children in her own house.  Since she was born her parents instilled the value of hard work, like field chores, in her.  Now, the fields she’s inherited serve to generate income for her that has helped her support her children who are now adults and upstanding citizens. 

She continues farming such vegetables as carrots, onions, spinach, chard and corn, which she dries and hulls to sell at wholesale.  She has it taken to Lima to sell at a sales stand that she acquired there.  She also sells fruit in said stand.  The stand has been in operation five years and it has produced good profits that compensate for the effort she’s put into the planting and harvesting seasons.  She feels very satisfied to have reached improved economic conditions and wants to continue working.

She’s been working with MFP for years.  She is a member that foments group unity in her communal bank.  She feels proud to have this responsibility and is encouraged to continue working this way.  She will use the requested loan to buy sacks of manure and also to buy fruit at wholesale to stock her fruit stand.

loans.use: to buy sacks of manure and to buy fruit.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase colorful African wax cloth.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
La Sra. Antonia tiene 41 años de edad, es soltera, tiene 3 hijos, de los cuales, dos son menores de edad y otro es mayor de edad, independiente y empleado de una fábrica.
La Sra. Antonia se dedica a la venta de bebidas en su domicilio hace aproximadamente 11 años, se inicio con un pequeño kiosco que luego de unos años se transformo en la venta exclusiva de bebidas.
Ella se define como una mujer muy emprendedora y trabajadora, por medio de su trabajo ella ha podido salir adelante con sus hijos. Desea poder seguir brindándoles lo mejor, para que en el futuro puedan ser personas útiles a la sociedad.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de bebidas, cervezas, gaseosas, vinos y otros con lo cual podra abastecer su local.
texts.en:
Señora Antonia is 41 years old, single and has three children. Two of her children are minors and one is an independent adult employed in a factory.

Señora Antonia has made her living for approximately 11 years selling beverages from her home. She started with a small snack stand that after a few years she transitioned into beverages exclusively.

She defines herself as an entrepreneurial and hardworking woman. Through her work she has been able to help her children get ahead. She hopes to be able to continue providing them with the best so that in the future they can be useful people to society.

She is requesting this loan to purchase beverages, beer, soft drinks, wine and other drinks that she can stock her store with.

loans.use: to buy beverages, beer, soft drinks, wine and other drinks.

loans.name: Las Animadoras Group

texts.en: Petrona, Ingrid, and Juana, all of whom reside in San Lorenzo, Honduras, formed the “Las Animadoras” solidarity group in June, 2011. Petrona and her husband make a living by selling seafood and vegetables out of their truck. She is a returning client and had a punctual payment history on her previous loan. Petrona is requesting a loan of HNL 10,000 to purchase a bulk amount of seafood and vegetables, which she will sell. Ingrid makes a living by selling freshly prepared food and Juana makes a living by operating a small convenience shop.

loans.use: to purchase shrimp, fish, tomatoes, peppers, carrots, corn, cucumbers, and onions.

loans.name: Akou

texts.fr:
Akou est une femme âgée de 42 ans. Elle est mariée å un directeur de société. Elle a 02 enfants.  
Akou travaille comme couturière depuis 2000. Elle travaille avec 10 employés.  
Akou a requis son deuxième crédit à WAGES afin d’acheter des machines à coudre.
texts.en: Akou is a 42 year old woman.  She is married to the director of a company.  She has two children.  Akou has worked as a seamstress since 2000.  She works with 10 employees.  Akou is requesting her second loan from WAGES in order to purchase a sewing machine.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en: Dolores is 36 years old and lives in Otavalo, Ecuador. She is married and lives with her husband. Dolores is a calm and peaceful person with desires to overcome the social and economic obstacles in her life. She is a seamstress who sews blouses and she sells livestock. Dolores seeks this loan to purchase cattle and material for the creation of blouses. She began making blouses by hand after learning the tradition from her mother. She has been dedicated to this business for 10 years. Her first loan was used to purchase a sewing machine that has allowed her to make blouses more rapidly. Dolores reports that her blouse-making business is going well and that she receives orders every week. Dolores believes that her loan will help her attain economic stability. Her dream is to purchase an embroidery machine and continue expanding her business.

loans.use: to purchase material to make blouses and to purchase cattle

loans.name: María

texts.es:
María forma parte del banco comunal “Fe y Unión” perteneciente a la comuna de Pudahuel, ciudad de Santiago.
Ella se dedica a vender productos de bazar en diferentes ferias los días martes a domingo, hasta las 14ºº horas. Trabaja en éste rubro desde hace 5 años, comenzó vendiendo ropa usada y después comenzó a incorporar artículos de bazar. Su mercadería la compra usualmente en el barrio Meiggs, comuna de Estación Central. Los días de más alta demanda son los fines de semana, ya que concurre más clientela a la feria libre. 
Con el crédito comprará pantuflas, pilas, candados, entre otros productos. 
Sus metas son comprar un vehículo para trasladar su mercadería, ya que por ahora solo traslada su mercadería en un triciclo y los fines de semana su marido, es quien se encarga de ayudarla.
María vive junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos. Sus sueños son que sus hijos obtengan su casa propia. 
Ella está muy agradecida del apoyo brindado por Fondo Esperanza, ya que ha podido invertir en su negocio. Comenta que el grupo del banco comunal al cual pertenece es muy bueno y unido. Respecto a las reuniones, éstas han sido muy buenas e interesantes, ya que le ha permitido conocer experiencias de otras socias en sus negocios. Las capacitaciones además le han servido para registrar sus gastos e ingresos en su propio negocio. 
Pudahuel es una comuna del sector poniente de Santiago (capital de Chile), región Metropolitana. Es un vocablo del mapudungun (lengua mapuche) que se traduce como “lugar donde se juntan las aguas” o “lugar de charcos”, debido a que posee una variada red fluvial compuesta por el río Mapocho y los esteros Lampa, Carén y Las Cruces, lo que favorece sus suelos para la producción agrícola por la existencia de abundante agua subterránea.
texts.en:
María is part of the “Fe y Unión” (Faith and Union) communal bank belonging to Pudahuel Commune in the city of Santiago.

She sells assorted household items in various markets from Tuesday to Sunday until 2pm.  She’s been in this line of work for five years.  She started out selling used clothes and later started adding household items.  She usually buys her merchandise in the Meiggs neighborhood, Estación Central commune.  Weekends are when demand is highest because more customers come to the street markets.

She will use the loan to buy slippers, batteries and padlocks, among other products.  Her goals are to buy a vehicle to transport her merchandise because currently she uses a three-wheeled cart and on weekends her husband takes care of helping her.  María lives with her husband and two children.  Her dreams are that her children acquire a house of their own.

She is very grateful for the support Fondo Esperanza has given her because she’s been able to invest in her business.  She comments that the group of the communal bank she belongs to is very good and united.  With respect to the meetings, they have been very good and interesting because she’s been able to learn about the experiences of other members.  The training sessions have also been useful for her to keep track of her expenses and income in her own business.

Pudahuel is a commune in the western part of Santiago (capital of Chile) Metropolitan Region.  It’s a Mapudungun (indigenous language) term meaning “place where the waters join together” or “place of puddles” because it has a varied network of waterways composed of the Mapocho River and the Lampa, Carén and Las Cruces marshes which make the soil favorable for agriculture due to the existence of abundant underground water.

loans.use: to buy slippers, batteries and padlocks, among other products.

loans.name: Yervacio

texts.es: El Sr. Yervacio  esta casado con la Sra. Nieves, son clientes antiguos de la institución ellos tienen tres hijas y un hijo, ellos viven en la comunidad de Unni la cual se encuentra a unos 20 min. De nuestra institución de chasquipampa los buses no pasan con mucha frecuencia que solo pasan en ciertos horarios establecidos, el Sr. Yervacio trabaja como transportista en el radio taxi y ella vende verduras en el mercado Rodríguez solo tres veces a la semana eses días ella va desde muy temprano para comprar las verduras de las señoras productoras para luego venderlos mas tarde, el Ayuda  su esposa con el transporte de sus verduras y algunas veces también le ayuda a comprar y vender, el solicita el credito para compra de repuestos y mantenimiento de su movilidad, es una persona muy trabajadora agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Yervacio is married to Nieves.  They are old customers of this institution and have three daughters and a son.  They live in the Unni community located 20 minutes away from La Paz.  From the Chasquipampa institution there are not very frequent buses and they only pass during certain established times.  Yervacio works as a driver for a radio taxi company and his wife sells vegetables in the Rodríguez market three times a week.  On those days she goes very early to buy the vegetables from the women who produce them and then sells them later.  He helps his wife transport the vegetables and sometimes helps her to buy and sell them.  He is requesting the loan to buy the parts and pay for maintenance on his vehicle.  He is a hard-working person who is very grateful to the institution for the support they offer.

loans.use: to buy parts and to pay for maintenance on his vehicle.

loans.name: Prosperidad Y Amistad Group

texts.es: La Sra. Aurora  es Divorciada, tiene 4 hijos en edad escolar, actualmente es integrante en la alcancía comunal “Prosperidad y Amistad” grupo  conformado por 7 socios que se dedican a diversas actividades D. comercio. Aurora  trabaja desD. hace   5 años en la venta D. comida D. Ceviche, Gaseosa, Golosinas  y  Mazamorra en un puesto en el mercado, este negocio surge a raíz D. su divorcio, ya que  Aurora tenía que mantener a sus 4 hijos , Aurora nos cuenta que nada fue fácil tuvo que trabajar muy duro para sacar adelante su negocio y sacar adelante a sus hijos.Su sueño es tener una bogega deabarrotes y ser mayorista , gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación a logrado mejores ingresos económicos, sus hijos van al colegio,se ha comprado artefactos electricos, y sobre todo su familia cuenta con una  mejor calidad D. vida, con el fin D. seguir creciendo a solicitado un nuevo préstamo para comprar insumos (golosinas). Sabemos que Aurora  cumplirá sus metas con mucho trabajo y esfuerzo y que los préstamos D. Edaprospo le ayudaran.
texts.en:
Señora Aurora is divorced and has four school age children. She is currently a member of the “Prosperidad y Amistad” communal bank. The group is maD. up of seven members that that work in different commercial enterprises. 

Aurora has worked for the past five years selling ceviche, soft drinks, sweets and mazamorra [a Peruvian corn-based desert] at a stall in the market. This business began as a result of her divorce. At that point Aurora had to support her four children. Aurora tells us that nothing was easy and she had to work very hard to get ahead in her business and help her children get ahead.

Her dream is to have a grocery store and be a wholesaler. Thanks to her great effort and dedication she has been able to increase her income, her children go to school, she has purchased electric appliances and above all her family has a better quality of life. To continue growing, she has requested a new loan to buy supplies of candies.

We know that Aurora will accomplish her goals with a lot of work and effort and that the loans from Edaprospo will help her.

loans.use: to buy supplies of sweets.

loans.name: Luzmila

texts.es: Luzmila radica en Chupaca desde hace más de 12 años, es separada  y está en  compañía de sus 3 hijos en su casa propia. Tiene 6 años trabajando en su tienda de abarrotes, negocio que lo tiene instalado en su misma casa,  pues vio la necesidad de abrir una tienda en su localidad como una buena oportunidad de negocio en la que puede abastecer a sus vecinos con productos de primera necesidad. De manera paralela vende animales, que luego de haberlos alimentado y alcanzado y peso adecuado, son vendidos en la feria comercial de su localidad. Actualmente su hija mayor la ayuda en la atención a los clientes, cuando ellos recurren a su tienda, así no deja de vender, pues ella se ha comprometido a trabajar como cobradora de pasajes en una empresa de transporte. Todas estas fuentes de ingreso son necesarias para cubrir las necesidades familiares ya que Luzmila es el único sostén familiar para sus hijos. Con el tiempo este negocio le ha resultado bueno en sus ganancias por lo que aumentará y renovará  la mercadería que normalmente ofrece. Tiene mucho tiempo trabajando con MFP mediante grupos solidarios y considera que es una aliada para  el progreso de su negocio porque siempre ha sabido invertir adecuadamente cada crédito que ha recibido. En la actualidad tiene 10 experiencias  de trabajo grupales anteriores de las cuales esta satisfecha de su permanencia en su grupo. Con el dinero que solicita,  lo invertirá en la compra de más mercadería para implementar su tienda.
texts.en: Luzmila has lived in Chupaca for more than 12 years.  She is separated and lives with her three children in her own home.  She has worked in her grocery store for six years, a business that she has put in her house as she saw the need to open a store in her area as a good business opportunity as she can supply her neighbors with staple products.  Alongside this she also sells animals, which after they have been fed and have reached an adequate weight are sold in the commercial market in her area.  Currently her oldest daughter helps her attend to customers when they come to her store, thus she doesn’t stop selling.  She has also committed to work selling tickets in a transport company.  All of these sources of income are necessary to cover the family necessities as Luzmila is the sole breadwinner for her children.  Over time this business has had good results for her profits and she would like to expand and renew the merchandise she normally offers.  She has worked with MFP for a long time through solidarity groups and considers it an ally for the progress of her business because she has always known to invest appropriately each loan that she has received.  Currently she has 10 previous experiences with group work and she is satisfied to stay in the group.  With the money she will invest in more merchandise to stock her store.

loans.use: to buy milk, rice, sugar, and soups.

loans.name: Olga Marina

texts.en: Olga lives in San Lorenzo, Honudras where she makes a living by selling a variety of goods out of her home. She sells undergarments, shoes, kitchenware, fruits, vegetables, snacks, and soft drinks. Olga has been engaged in this small business for the past 30 years. She is requesting a loan of HNL 10,000 to purchase undergarments and kitchenware, which she will sell.

loans.use: to purchase undergarments, plates, bowls, cups and glasses.

loans.name: Adela

texts.es: La Sra. Adela  tiene como actividad confección de poleras y buzos deportivos, Vive en la Zona La Merced de la Ciudad de La Paz, esta actividad que realiza es la fuente principal de ingresos para ella  y su familia, tiene tres hijos que están en Colegio de la misma zona, el esposo es empleado publico de una fábrica de textil, es una persona muy dinámica y emprendedora , en esta oportunidad solicita crédito para incremento de capital comprando una variedad de telas y  a la vez tiene la visión de ser una microempresaria,  para satisfacer sus pedidos y entregas del productor al consumidor, de esta manera busca lograr y  mejorar sus ingresos para el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
Adela works making polo shirts and track suits.  She lives in the La Merced area of the city of La Paz.  Her work is the main source of income for her and her family.  She has three children who are in high school in the same area.  Her husband is employed at a textile factory.  She is a dynamic and enterprising person. 

She is asking for this loan to increase her capital and purchase a variety of fabrics.  She has the vision to be a micro-entrepreneur in order to satisfy her orders and deliveries from producer to the consumer.  In this way, she will look for success and improve her income for the well-being of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fabric to make polo shirts.

loans.name: Orfilia

texts.en: Orfilia lives in San Lorenzo, Honduras where she makes a living by selling basic foodstuffs out of her home. She has been engaged in this small business for many years and was among the first in her village to open a small general store. She is requesting a loan of HNL 12,000 to purchase merchandise.

loans.use: to purchase bread, cheese, snacks, candy, soft drinks, juices, beans, rice, corn, cornmeal, and sugar.

loans.name: Las Estrellitas De San Antonio Group

texts.es: Blanca es una mujer D. 32 años D. edad nació en una provincia del Perú, actualmente radica en la capital, es conviviente y tiene 1 hija,  la cual  ha sido su motivo para seguir adelante, hace 5 años abrió un puesto D. venta D. útiles D.  librería que lleva el nombre D. “Cotito”, su negocio está ubicado en una galería cerca D. su comunidad donD. además ella realiza trabajos manuales para poder ofrecerlo en su negocio. Blanca se  proyecta a comprar su propio stand ya que solo es alquilado para seguir trabajando positivamente y apoyar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar y brindarle una mejor vida a su familia,  Cabe mencionar que Blanca  es una persona D. trato amable, perseverante y solidario. Con el crédito piensa invertir en la compra D. blondas, crepes, colores, crayolas, corrospun, lapiceros, borradores que le ayudaran a tener mayores ganancias.  La Sra. Blanca junto a La Alcancía Comunal “Las Estrellitas D. San Antonio” agradecen por la oportunidad   brindada para el capital D. trabajo D. sus negocios.
texts.en: Blanca is a 32-year-old woman who was born in a province of Peru. She is currently based in the capital, with her common-law husband and one daughter, who has been her motivation for getting ahead. Five years ago, she opened a sales stand for paper supplies with the name of “Cotito.” Her business is located in a shopping center near her community, where she also makes handicrafts to sell in her business. Blanca plans to buy her own stand in the future, since the one she uses is rented. This will allow her to keep working in a positive direction, help her husband with the household expenses, and proviD. a better life for her family. It is worth mentioning that Blanca is a persistent person with a friendly demeanor and a strong sense of solidarity. With the loan, she is planning to invest in buying doilies, crepe paper, paints, crayons, foam board, pens and erasers, which will help her increase her profits. Blanca and the other members of her communal bank, “Las Estrellitas D. San Antonio” ["The Little Stars of San Antonio"], are grateful for the opportunity provided to them to expand the working capital of their businesses.

loans.use: to buy doilies, crepe paper, paints, crayons, foam board, pens and erasers.

loans.name: Brunilda

texts.es:
Brunilda forma parte del banco comunal “Rompiendo Barreras”, perteneciente a la ciudad de Temuco.
Ella se dedica a vender ropa de segunda mano, ropa nueva y plantas, desde su casa o visita las casas de sus clientes. Trabaja en éste rubro desde hace 23 años, durante éste tiempo le ha ido muy bien en su negocio y mantiene la clientela de sus comienzos. 
Con el crédito comprará ropa nueva, ropa de segunda mano, lencería, manteles y cortinas.
Sus metas en su negocio son abastecer su negocio con una mayor cantidad de mercadería, para vender y obtener mayores ganancias. Además tiene contemplado para éste año, arrendar un local establecido para vender su mercadería de manera más tranquila y menos sacrificada. 
Brunilda vive junto a sus dos hijos de 26 y 25 años de edad, además de dos nietos de 13 y 8 años de edad. Comenta que durante su vida ha podido cumplir sus sueños, por lo que por ahora se encuentra tranquila. 
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida del crédito brindado por Fondo Esperanza, ya que le ha permitido invertir en su negocio. Respecto al grupo del banco comunal al cual pertenece, comparte con ellos desde hace 5 años, por lo que la relación es muy grata, debido a la unidad y solidaridad. 
Temuco es la capital de la región de la Araucanía. La ciudad se ubica a 670 kilómetros al sur de Santiago (capital de Chile). En sus alrededores se ubican una serie de balnearios lacustres (Pucón, Villarrica) y una flora y fauna nativa muy llamativas, concentrada en parques naturales cercanos. Cabe destacar que en esta región habita el 50% de los mapuches, pueblo indígena, existente en nuestro país.
texts.en:
Brunilda is a member of the “Rompiendo Barreras” [Breaking Barriers], community bank in the city of Temuco. She sells second hand clothes, new clothes and plants from her house or by visiting customers' houses. She has done this for 23 years and during that time it has gone very well for her in the business. She maintains the same customers she has had from the beginning. 
 
With the loan, she will buy new clothes, second hand clothes, lingerie, tablecloths and curtains. Her goals for her business are to supply her business with a larger quantity of merchandise to sell and obtain more earnings. She also has planned for this year renting a locale to sell her merchandise more calmly and in an easier way. 
 
Brunilda lives with her two children, aged 26 and 25 years old. She also has two grandchildren, aged 13 and 8. She remarks that she has been able to make her dreams come true in her life, and that is why she feels calm now. She is very happy and grateful for the loan offered by Fondo Esperanza since it has allowed her to invest in her business. In regards to the community bank group to which she belongs, she has been with them for 5 years and they get along very well, due to the unity and supportiveness.
 
Temuco is the capital of the Araucanía region. The city is located 670 kilometers to the south of Santiago (the capital of Chile). Nearby are a series of lake beaches (Pucón, Villarrica) and very striking flora and fauna in the nearby nature parks. It is worth mentioning that this region is where 50% of Mapuches, and indigenous people, live in our country.

loans.use: to buy new clothes, second hand clothes, lingerie, tablecloths and curtains.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: Maria es una mujer muy trabajadora e independiente, a sus 44 años vive con sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. Desde su niñez realiza estos bellos bordados en faldas típicas de su región. Su trabajo lo realiza diariamente en su casa, pero los fines de semana los lleva al mercado local de su zona para venderla a los comerciantes de trajes típicos. Es por eso que cada día tiene que  avanzar regularmente para que  tenga más prendas que vender. Para ella es clave tener siempre disponible y a la mano sus materiales. Por otro lado cría cerdos que luego de 3 meses son vendidos en la feria ganadera de su localidad. Afirma que le gusta trabajar más en el bordado porque no requiere de mucho esfuerzo físico pero si de mucha creatividad, además su trabajo no tiene pierde porque su producto no es perecible como los alimentos. Por ahora aprovechará las festividades de su zona ya que hay más demanda de las prendas que vende. Afirma que le agrada trabajar de manera grupal con MFP como lo viene haciendo desde hace 12 ciclos de trabajo de las cuales tiene un buen record de puntualidad en sus pagos y lo seguirá demostrando en el futuro. Con el dinero que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de hilos y telas al por mayor para aprovechar estos meses donde tiene mayor demanda de los bordados.
texts.en: Maria is a hardworking and independent woman. She is 44 years old and lives with her 2 children in their own home.  Since childhood, she has made beautiful embroidery on the traditional skirts of the region. She does her work from home everyday but on weekends she takes them to the local market to sell to the traditional clothing merchants. This is why every day she has to get ahead in order to have more clothing to sell. For her it is key to always have her materials available. On the other hand, she raises pigs that she sells after 3 months in the livestock fair of her community. She states that she likes to work more with the embroidery because it doesn't require as much physical strength but does require a lot of creativity. Also, it doesn't have any losses, because she doesn't have to pay for feed. For now, she will take advantage of the area's festivities since there will be more demand for the clothes she sells. She states that she likes to work with the group from MFP as she has done for 12 work cycles during which she has had a good payment record as she will continue to have in the future. With the money she is asking for, she will invest in buying thread and fabric wholesale to take advantage of these months, when there is a higher demand for embroidered clothing.

loans.use: to buy thread and fabric wholesale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase beef, chicken, pork, cornmeal, rice, beans, tomatoes, peppers, corn, plantains, cheese, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Gregorio Magno

texts.es:
Gregorio de 51 años, es un hombre trabajador que es taxista y tiene un negocio de venta de zapatos.  Trabaja desde muy temprano en la mañana en su taxi recorriendo las calles de Guayaquil.  Tiene muchos impedimentos para recorrer las calles de Guayaquil ya que en estos años que ha estado trabajando se ha incrementado la delincuencia.    

Trabaja todos los días en su taxi pero también se dedica en horas libres a elaborar y vender zapatos. Tiene muchas aspiraciones con sus dos negocios ya que le han permitido mantener a su familia. El quiere con el préstamo comprar zapatos y herramientas para su carro y así mejorar sus ingresos familiares.
texts.en:
Gregorio is 51 years old. He is a hardworking taxi driver. He also has a business selling shoes. He works very early in the morning in his taxi, driving around the streets of Guayaquil. He has a lot of trouble soliciting business traveling around the streets of Guayaquil, which is why he is working in another business to increase his salary. 
He works every day in his taxi and in his free time he makes and sells shoes. He has a lot of dreams for both of his jobs, mainly that they will allow him to support his family. With this loan he would like to buy shoes and buy tools for his taxi. In this way he will increase the family’s earnings.

loans.use: to buy shoes and tools.

loans.name: Soneyda Fidelina

texts.en: Soneyda lives in a town called Nacaome in southern Honduras where she makes a living selling clothes. She works in a number of different parts of town and has a steady clientele. Soneyda is requesting a loan of HNL12,000 to purchase merchandise.

loans.use: to purchase shirts, blouses, pants, skirts, dresses, socks, and underwear.

loans.name: Daniel Antonio

texts.es:
A sus 68 años de edad, Daniel Antonio se considera un luchador, que hace 20 decidió no dejarse derrotar por los problemas de orden publico que se le presentaron en su tierra natal Urabá, un municipio que hace parte del departamento de Antioquia, ya que de allí tuvo que salir como desplazado hacia Medellín donde emprendió un nuevo negocio en el cual se desempeñaba como lustrador de zapatos, posteriormente y gracias a sus ganas de salir adelante pudo tener un lugar que le presta el municipio para sostener su negocio y es allí donde hoy en día sigue prestando no sólo este servicio si no que además arregla zapatos y vende algunos dulces que le ayudan a mejorar las ganancias.

Daniel sueña con llegar a tener un establecimiento más grande, que sea reconocido y donde pueda vender gran variedad de productos. Pero para ello necesita un préstamo con el cual pueda comenzar a cumplir este sueño, con él comprara surtido de dulces e insumos para el arreglo de los zapatos, así su negocio comenzará a crecer y su calidad de vida mejorará proporcionalmente
texts.en:
Daniel Antonio, at 68 years old, is considered a fighter. Since he was 20 he decided to not be defeated by the problems caused by the state. These problems occurred in his birthplace called Urabá. Urabá is a town in the department of Antioquia. He had to leave this town because he was exiled to Medellín. In Medellín he learned a new business, shining shoes. After this, and thanks to desire to progress, he was able to secure a place in the town where he could locate his business. Today his business is in this location. Now he not only shines shoes, but also fixes them and also sells some sweets. This allows him to improve his earnings.
Daniel would like to have a larger location for his business that would have customer recognition.  In this place he could sell a greater variety of products. In order to reach his goals he needs a loan. With this loan he will buy a variety of sweets and products to be used to repair shoes. In this way his business will begin to grow and his quality of life will grow also.

loans.use: to buy goods thereby creating a greater variety of goods for his business.

loans.name: Flor De Mburucuya Group

texts.es:
El comité denominado Flor de Mburucuya, esta integrado por 18 mujeres. Todas ellas son amigas y vecinas de la ciudad de Mariano Roque Alonso. Una de las miembros había escuchado sobre el programa de mujeres emprendedoras, y entusiasmada por la idea las organizó y de allí surgió el grupo.
El comité trabaja de forma unida y responsable, todas ellas se consideran muy trabajadoras y luchadoras. Lo que las impulso a unirse es el deseo de progresos que todas ellas tienen. Desean tener un mejor futuro para sus hijos y mayores ingresos para llevar a sus hogares.
La Sra. Genara se dedica a la venta de bebidas de todo tipo, por medio de este trabajo ella ha podido salir adelante con su familia.
Ella solicita el credito para la compra de bebidas, como ser cervezas, gaseosas y demás. Ella sabe que le sera de gran ayuda este crédito.
texts.en:
The “Flower of Mburucuya” Committee is made up of 18 women. All of them are friends and neighbors in the city of Mariano Roque Alonso. One of the members heard about this program for women entrepreneurs. Energized by this ides, she organized this group and that is how the group was formed.
The committee works in an organized and responsible fashion. All of the women are hardworking and fighters. What caused them to united is the desire that all of them have to progress. They want a better future for their children and greater earnings to bring to their homes.
Mrs. Genara sells all types of drinks. In this way she is able to progress with her family.
She is requesting this loan in order to buy drinks such as beer, sodas and other types of drinks. She knows that this loan will be a great help to her.

loans.use: to buy drinks such as beer and soda.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy gourds and pay for transportation to go to the northern part of the country.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en: Nancy is 35 years old and lives in the city of Otavalo, Ecuador. She is married and lives with her husband and two children who are 10 and 4 years old, respectively. Nancy is an entrepreneurial person who works day-to-day for the well-being of her family. She is a seamstress who dedicates her time to creating embroidered blouses that are popular with the indigenous community in the region. Nancy is obtaining a loan to purchase four rolls of material to make these blouses. She began her business with a single sewing machine six years ago. Now she works with two sewing machines and two machines that do embroidery. She currently works with two other seamstresses. Nancy hopes that this loan will help increase her income and allow her to hire another co-worker. Her dream for the future is to covert her workshop into an industry where many people work. She hopes to hire others so that their families may benefit from her business as her family has.

loans.use: to buy rolls of cloth for her sewing and embroidery workshop

loans.name: San Ramon Group

texts.es:
20 Señoras  trabajadoras se unierón para formar un grupo, denominado San Ramón, donde el compromiso es conjunto y la clave del éxito es poseer un espiritu emprendedor, las mismas residen en la Ciudad de Caaguazú, actualmente están en el 2do. Ciclo y estan muy animadas de seguir progresando.
La Sra. modesta tiene un pequeño almacén, donde tiene todo tipo de cosas, por medio de este pequeño establecimiento ella ha podido salir adelante junto con su familia. Ella sueña con algún día poder ampliar su pequeño local, ya que de esa forma podrá ofrecer mas comodidad a sus clientes. Ella se dedica a esto hace ya unos años, con lo que ya tiene una clientela definida.
Ella solicita el credito para la compra de variados productos para poder abastecer su local, como ser azúcar, carne, harina, huevo, fideo, golosinas, queso y demás, con lo que podrá paliar la demanda que tiene.
texts.en:
Twenty women workers united to form the group called San Ramón. The group promises to meet and the glue that holds them together is their entrepreneurial spirit. They live in Caaguazú City. This is their second loan cycle and they are very excited to continue to move forward.
Mrs. Modesta has a small store that carries all types of things. With this small establishment she is able to progress with her family. She dreams that one day she can increase the size of her small store in order to provide a more comfortable place for her customers. She has had her business for two years and has a stable customer base.
She is asking for this loan in order to buy a variety of goods in order to stock her store, items such as sugar, meat, flour, eggs, noodles, hard candies, cheese and other items that she will buy according to customer demand.

loans.use: to buy sugar, meat, flour, eggs, noodles and hard candies in order to supply her store.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es: Maria Del Carmen tiene 39 años, vive en con sus dos hijos menores de edad a su cargo. Maria posee un negocio que es una pulpería, cuenta con gran afluencia de clientes debido a la buena calidad de servicio que ella viene ofreciendo desde hace 8 años, además existe variedad en cuanto a los productos que su tienda posee. Ella desea invertir en su negocio en la compra de granos básicos, golosinas, pan, jugos, enlatados y sopas.
texts.en: Maria del Carmen is 39 years old. She lives with her two young children who are dependent on her. She has a small grocery store. Her customers speak of her with great esteem. For the past eight years she has offered them good service. She also offers a great variety of products at her store. She would like to invest in her business by buying basic food supplies such as hard candies, bread, juice, canned goods and soups.

loans.use: to buy basic food supplies such as candy, bread, juice, canned goods and soups.

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
Este Comité se formo gracias a la Señora Nilda. Ella se motivo en la idea D. producir un bien para sus compañeras, dando una visión D. que a través del comité estarían alcanzando un  nuevo progreso. Cada una
encantada aceptó conformar el comité al que denominaron KUÑA GUAPA.
El comité cuenta con 15 miembros, donD. todas ellas trabajan D. forma solidaria y responsable. Saben que por medio D. su esfuerzo podrán llegar muy lejos. Todas tienen la esperanza D. seguir luchando para salir adelante, buscando el progreso D. cada una D. ellas y la D. su comunidad.
La Sra. Maria C. es modista ya hace un buen tiempo, tiene una buena cantidad D. clientes. Por medio D. este oficio ella pueD. mantenerse y mantener su casa. Ella esta orgullosa D. lo que hace, y comenta que todo su sacrificio es por un futuro digno para ella y su familia.
Solicita el credito para la compra D. telas y kits D. agujas ademas D. hilos, los cuales utilizara en su labor.
texts.en:
This committee was formed thanks to Nilda. She got the idea to do something good for her partners, giving them a vision that through this committee they will reach a new level of progress. Each one accepted happily and maD. a group they called KUÑA GUAPA.

The group is maD. up of 15 members, all of whom work together and are responsible. They know that through their efforts they will be able to go far. They all have the hope of continuing to move forward, seeking progress for each one of them and their community. 

Maria has been a seamstress for some time and she has a good customer base. Through this work she is able to take care of herself and her home. She is proud of what she does and says that everything she sacrifices is for a worthy future for herself and her family.

She asks for a loan to buy fabric and needle kits, as wells as thread that she will use for her work.

loans.use: to buy fabric, needles and thread.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy corn, lime, firewood and bags.

loans.name: Maria Cristina

texts.es: Maria Cristina de 67 años, es la propietaria de un negocio de panadería, que  está ubicada en su vivienda. Maria inició su negocio desde hace más de 21 años, cuando su Mama se dedicaba anteriormente a esta actividad en el hogar y desde ese momento ha crecido, fue con el paso del tiempo que Maria decide hacerse cargo del establecimiento. Esta es la razón por la cual acude al crédito con el cual comprará de harina, huevo, mantequilla, leche entre otros. Su meta más adelante es tener un local propio para lograr una mejor comodidad en su hogar.
texts.en: Maria Cristina, 67, is the owner of a bakery located in her home. Maria started this business more than 21 years ago. Her mother used to do the same thing at home and it has grown from the moment it started. Over time, Maria decided to take charge of the business. For this reason she needs a loan to buy flour, eggs, butter, milk and other things. Her goal for the future is to have her own store space so that her home will be more comfortable.

loans.use: to buy flour, eggs, butter and milk, among other things.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
La Sra. Gladys es una persona muy trabajadora, D. 50 años D. edad,esta casada.Ella posee una pequeña despensa en la Ciudad D. Itá, esto la ha ayudado a generar una buena cantidad D. ingresos.
La cliente comenta que por medio D. la despensa pueD. mantener lo gastos D. la casa, ademas D. eso, su marido la ayuda con los gastos, por medio D. su trabajo D. agricultor. Ella se define como una mujer muy sacrificada y esta muy contenta D. trabajar, ya que sabe que el trabajo es la única forma D. salir adelante.
Solicita el credito para la compra D. carne, legumbres, bebidas, hortalizas y demás para ofrecerlos en su negocio. Esta esperanzada en el credito ya que sabe que le sera D. grana ayuda.
texts.en: Mrs. Gladys is a very hard working person.  She is 50 years old and married.  She has a small shop in the city of Itá, and this has helped her earn a good living.  She shares that the store allows her to proviD. for many expenses of the home.  Her husband also helps with the expenses with his work as a farmer.  She describes herself as a very sacrificial woman and she is very happy to work, as she knows that work is the only way to get ahead.  She is asking for the loan to buy meat, legumes, beverages, vegetables, and other products to offer for sale in her business.  She is hopeful for the loan because she knows it will be of great help to her.

loans.use: buy meat, legumes, drinks, vegetables, and more.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy oil, rice, sugar, beans, salt and coffee.

loans.name: Braulio Manuel

texts.es: Braulio tiene 31 años tiene 1 hijo de 4 años a su cargo. El es muy trabajador y emprendedor. Se dedica a vender ropa nueva, tiene más de 3 años en este negocio, emprendió su negocio para tener su dinero propio y proporcionarle a su familia los ingresos necesarios, el realiza la ofertas de sus productos de manera ambulante pues es la única forma  que tiene una gran cantidad de clientes. El sueño de Braulio es obtener un local en el mercado, pues es aquí donde circulan más clientes. El crédito es para la compra de pantalones, camisas, faldas, vestidos, trajes y faldas.
texts.en: Braulio, 31, has a four-year-old son under his care.   A hard working and enterprising man, he has been earning a living selling new clothing for three years.  He started his business to earn his own money and provide his family with the necessary income.  In order to reach more customers he sells his products as a street vendor.  Braulio's goal is to set up a stall at the market where there are even more customers.  He plans to use the loan to buy trousers, shirts, skirts, dresses, suits and skirts.

loans.use: To buy trousers, shirts, dresses, suits and skirts.

loans.name: Santa Anselma

texts.es:
Santa de 54 años, es una mujer trabajadora que tiene una pequeña tienda en la parte delantera de su casa.  Comenzó la tienda de víveres porque no podía trabajar en otro lugar que no sea su casa porque sus hijos estaban pequeños y no podía cuidarlos así que decidió tener su propia tienda. 

En la actualidad ya tiene 10 años con su tienda de víveres. Trabaja constantemente todo el día vendiendo dulces, enlatados, artículos de bazar  etc. Tiene muchas aspiraciones con su negocio por eso se levanta desde las 06h00am hasta las 20h00pm todos los días. Para seguir con su negocio ella quiere comprar con el préstamo artículos de bazar y papelería. En el futuro quiere continuar con su negocio.
texts.en:
Santa, 54, is a hard-working woman who runs a small store out of the front of her house.  She started selling groceries when she was unable to work elsewhere because her children were young, so she decided to open a store.

She has been in business for 10 years and works constantly selling sweets, canned goods, bazar items, etc.  She has high hopes for her business and works every day from 6:00 a.m. to 8:00 p.m.  She plans to use the loan to buy bazar items and stationery products.  Her goal is to continue with her business.

loans.use: To buy bazar items and notebooks

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for university tuition and buy books.

loans.name: Eulalio

texts.es: Eulalio de 55 años es soltero, trabaja para como Vigilante desde hace 18 meses. Esta solicitando  su 3er credito con el objetivo de continuar la construccion de su casita ya que con el credito anterior solo pudo comprar algunos materiales para iniciar los arranques, pues su mayor deseo esbrindarle a su familia la oportunidad de tener una casa propia y digna para vivir en ella.
texts.en: Eulalio, 55, is single and has been working as a security guard for 18 months.  He is requesting his third loan to continue building his house.  The previous loan he took out was used to buy materials to get started.  His goal is to provide his family with the opportunity to live in a dignified house that is their own.

loans.use: To build a house.

loans.name: Faustino

texts.es:
El señor Faustino es casado, vive en la ciudad de Pilar, se dedica a hacer productos chacinados, embutidos caseros, etc. desde hace 10 años. Posee casa propia, con las comodidades dentro del bienestar familar, posee movil de transporte propio.
El señor manifiesta haber trabajado desde pequeño en la elaboración de esos productos. Cuenta que todo el sacrificio que realiza es por darle a su familia lo mejor. Se denomina a si mismo como un hombre trabajador, y emprendedor y sueña con poder abrir algún día un local donde vender sus productos.
El solicita el credito para la compra de insumos para su negocio, es decir carne de cerdo, condimentos y demás ingredientes.
Sabe que por medio de este credito podrá garantizarse los insumos para la elaboración de sus productos en el futuro.
.
texts.en:
Faustino is married.  He lives in the city of Pilar and makes cold cuts, home-made sausages etc.  He has been doing this for 10 years.  He owns his own home with all its comforts and lives with his family.  He also owns his own vehicle.

Faustino tells us that he has worked making these products since he was a boy.  He tells us that all the sacrifice he makes is for his family, so that he can provide them with the best.  He describes himself as a hard-working and entrepreneurial man and he dreams of being able to some day open premises where he can sell his products.

Faustino is requesting this loan so that he can buy supplies for his business, that is to say pork, herbs and spices, and other ingredients.  He knows that this loan will allow him to have available the supplies that he needs to make his products in the future.

loans.use: to buy pork, herbs and spices, etc.

loans.name: Aquiles Adalberto

texts.es:
Aquiles trabaja para la Alcaldia Muncipal de Juigalpa desde hace 29 años, desempeñandose como  conductor. 

Esta solicitando  su 2do credito con el objetivo de poner el piso de su casa y si el dinero le alcanza cambier el zinc de la cocina que se encuentra en mal estado. 

Su mayor sueño es poder brindarle a su familia mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Aquiles has worked for Juigalpa city council as a driver for 29 years.  He is requesting his second loan with the aim of laying flooring in his home and, if the money stretches far enough, he will replace the metal roof on his kitchen which is in a bad state of repair.

Aquiles' biggest dream is to provide his family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to replace his roof

loans.name: Demesio

texts.es:
Demesio es trabajador de la Alcaldia Muncipal de Juigalpa desde hace 4 años, desempeñandose como operario de limpieza.  

Esta solicitando refinanciamiento de su 4to credito con el objetivo de construir una letrina, pues la que tiene esta deteriorandose, y como el invierno esta comenzado quiere poder hacerla para evitar cualquier inconveniente o enfermedades para su familia. 

Su mayor sueño es poder brindarle a su familia mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Demesio has been working for the municipality of Juigalpa for 4 years, earning a living as a cleaner.
He is applying to refinance his 4th loan in order to construct a latrine as the one he has is deteriorating and, as the winter is coming, he wants to have it in place to avoid any inconvenience or illness for his family. 
His greatest dream is to be able to give his family better living conditions.

loans.use: Construccion de letrina

loans.name: Sofia

texts.es: Sofía es natural de Chupaca, es viuda y en la actualidad vive con sus 2 hijos en su casa propia que heredó de sus padres. Desde hace más de 2 años posee una tienda, siempre se ha dedicado al negocio, en un inicio tenía un restaurante, que se encontraba en una zona céntrica de la ciudad, sin embargo tuvo que cerrarla porque no le generaba las ganancias suficientes. Ahora con éste nuevo negocio, que instaló en su misma casa, vende productos de primera necesidad, así como también refrescos y gaseosas, para dar mayor comodidad a sus clientes, pues cuenta con mesas y sillas para que ellos tranquilamente puedan consumir algún producto. Sus hijos la ayudan en la atención hacía los clientes, pero lo que más prioriza es poder implementarla de más productos, que sean de mayor demanda de sus compradores. En adelante piensa retomar nuevamente el negocio de venta de comida. Fue invitada por una de sus vecinas que conforma un grupo solidario a formar parte de ese equipo con MFP y lo ve como una gran oportunidad para mejorar su negocio de las cuales esta muy agradecida y por tanto se compromete a responder puntualmente en el pago de sus cuotas. Con el dinero que solicita,  lo invertirá en la compra de más mercadería en abarrotes.
texts.en: Sofía is a native of Chupaca. She's a widow and she currently lives with her 2 children in her own house, which she inherited from her parents.
