Este será su sexto crédito por lo cual esta agradecida a los financistas por apoyarla a seguir progresando, esta vez espera contar con el apoyo D. ustedes para  seguir avanzando y por enD. se compromete en pagar sus cuotas puntualmente. Con los 1,000 nuevos soles comprará variedad D. verduras.
texts.en:
Sabina is from the city of Quimbiri.  She is 51 years old.  She is a widow who struggles for the well being of her 2 dear children for whom she provides a roof where they quietly spend their days. Over the years she continues to fight for the best welfare of her children and herself.

Sabina is a business woman and eager to continue working.  She works in the vegetable business where she offers a variety of produce such as lettuce, garlic, celery, and carrots.  Her selling post is located in the Quimbiri market where she has worked for 25 years.  Previously she would sell her products door to door.  

Since the Municipality in the Quimbiri district finished construction of the market, Sabina and many other merchants nowadays offer their goods in compliance with the regulation of municipal ordinances.

The sale of vegetables generates good earnings thanks to them asphalting the land.  However, the expense of her children's education is very large and the reason why she has turned to the loans so that she can buy vegetables for her business. Her future plan is to buy another post where she can sell staple products and thus rely on two incomes. 

This will be her 6th loan and she is pleased to have the financing to help her continue progressing.  This time she hopes to get the support of you guys to continue advancing and therefore she agrees to pay her dues on time.  With the 1,000 soles she will buy a variety of vegetables.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables for her business.

loans.name: Blanca Nevai

texts.es: Blanca abora como docente de tiempo completo en la Universidad URACCAN desde hace 4 años, su esposo trabaja  como ejecutivo de ventas, ambos   comparten con los gastos familiares y con los compromisos adquiridos, pues son muy unidos.  Ademàs cuentan otros ingresos de venta de productos de la finca y de leche.  Este credito lo requiere para mejorar la infraestructura de su vivienda y asi gozar de mejores condiciones junto a su familia, Su mayor sueño en la vida es tener estabilidad laboral y que su linda familia permanezca bien unida.
texts.en:
For 4 years Blanca has worked full time as a teacher at the URACCAN University.  Her husband works as a sales executive. Both share in the family expenses and commitments as they are very united.   They also have other income from sale of farm products and milk.  

This loan is required in order to improve the infrastructure of their house and thus enjoy better conditions with her family.  Her biggest dream in life is to have job security and for her beautiful family to stay well connected.

loans.use: to improve her home.

loans.name: Albertina Del Rosario

texts.es: Doña Albertina de  44 años de edad es casada, trabaja como docente en una Escuela del muncipio de Nueva Guinea, su esposo la ayuda con los gastos del hogar y con los pagos de sus compromisos. Albertina esta solicitando su 3er  crèdito para areglar un poco su vivienda, se caracteriza por ser una docente muy responsable, honesta y bien luchadora, es muy querida en su comunidad por ser una docente muy abnegada con su trabajo, su mayor sueño en la vida es que su familia gozen de mucha salud y permanezca  unida.
texts.en:
Mrs. Albertina is 44 years old, married and works as a teacher at a school in the municipality of New Guinea.  Her husband helps with home expenses and with loan payments.  

Albertina is requesting her 3rd loan to fix up her home.  She is known to be a responsible teacher, who is honest and a good fighter.  She is a very well-liked teacher in the community for being devoted to her work.  Her biggest dream in life is for her family to enjoy good health and stay close.

loans.use: to repair her home.

loans.name: Huo

texts.en:
Mrs. Huo, 23, is a married woman and the mother of a kid who lives under her care. Since 2000, she has worked in a crop-planting business on her own land, making an income of approximately $3 each day. Her husband is a mobile construction worker in Siem Reap Province. 

Mrs. Huo’s husband is concerned that he faces difficulties in traveling to his workplace. Her husband always travels to work by hiring a taxi or walking because he doesn’t have his own vehicle. To solve the problem, Mrs. Huo has requested a loan in the amount of $300 to add with her personal savings to be used to buy a used motorcycle to provide transportation without hiring a taxi.

loans.use: to buy a used motorcycle for her husband to drive to work.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy additional meat, frozen foods and plastic ware.

loans.name: Sheila

texts.en:
Sheila is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a rice retailing business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more rice and ready-to-wear clothes to sell. Sheila has been in this business for 3 years. Sheila earns more income from ready-to-wear clothes.

Sheila has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more rice and ready-to-wear clothes to sell.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is 37 years old and married with two children. With one child in school, Marilou works very hard to provide for her family.

Marilou runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell. Marilou has been in this business for 13 years and sells a variety of items such as soft drinks, bread, noodles, and sugar.

Marilou would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa works hard to support her family. Elisa is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Elisa requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more ingredients for her business. Elisa has been in this business for 25 years now.

In the future, Elisa would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more ingredients for her business.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is 26 years old and married. She works very hard to provide for her family.

Mary Ann sells sea cucumbers in the Philippines. She requested an 18,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more sea cucumbers and lobsters to sell. Mary Ann has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items such as lobster and sea cucumber.

In the future Mary Ann would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more sea cucumbers and lobsters to sell.

loans.name: Angeles

texts.en:
Angeles is 55 years old, married, and has three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Angeles has a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines. Angeles requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase fishing materials and to repair her fishing boat.

Angeles has been in this business for nine years. In the future, Angeles would like to save enough money to provide financial stability for her family.

loans.use: To purchase fishing materials and to repair her fishing boat

loans.name: Elsita

texts.en:
Elsita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing 20,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase fishing materials for her fishing/fish vending business. Elsita has been in this business for seven years. Elsita earns more income from the buying and selling of charcoal and from dried fish vending.

Elsita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase fishing materials.

loans.name: Santalat's Group

texts.en:
Santalat is the leader of this group. She is 47 and married to a cattle breeder. Together with her husband she has raised two sons and a daughter. Under the Kyrgyz traditions, the younger son lives with his parents. The older son went to work in Russia, and the daughter studies in Bishkek (the capital of Kyrgyzstan). 

In order to earn money to meet their daily needs, the family breeds cattle and then resells it at a higher price. In this way the family earns about 5,000 KGS (~$113) per month. With money received from the loan, Santalat wants to purchase more cattle for breeding. In the future, with the profits gained from reselling cattle, Santalat wants to build a house for her older son.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Madelyn

texts.en:
Madelyn is a married woman with 3 children, aged 22, 15 and 8. She lives in the town of Santa Josefa, Agusan Del Sur, with her family.

Madelyn is a farmer. She has been growing rice for 20 years now. She said farming is full of challenges but she is eager to earn for her family. She requested a loan to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies. She hopes that this loan will help increase her harvest.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Vicky

texts.en: Vicky is 37 years old and married with 3 school-aged children. She is a farmer working in the Philippines, and she has been doing this work for 10 years. Vicky is asking for a loan of 25,000 PHP to purchase herbicides, fuel for irrigation and fertilizers such as manure. Vicky hopes that this loan will benefit her operations. Currently, in this line of work she earns about 30,000 PHP (~$720) each harvest. Vicky wants to get high yields on her farm to sustain the needs of her children in school so as to attain her biggest dream in life, which is to finish the education of her children.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, herbicides and fuel for irrigation.

loans.name: Modesta

texts.en:
Modesta is 47 years old and is a married woman with 4 children. The oldest child is 26 years old while the youngest is only 5. Modesta's husband works as a farmer and as a Barangay (village) Official.

Modesta is also a farmer. She helps her husband till their land located in Santa Josefa, Agusan Del Sur. Rice is the primary crop that they grow to sell. According to Modesta, they recently earned about 4,000 PHP (~$100) per month from farming.

This loan will be used to purchase fertilizers, herbicides and insecticides. She hopes that their farm will grow.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, herbicides and insecticides.

loans.name: Novelyn

texts.en:
25-year-old Novelyn is a married woman with 3 young children aged 5, 3 and 1. She and her husband are both farmers. They till their own land, which is located in Veruela, Agusan Del Sur. They grow rice to sell at the market.

Novelyn has requested a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers and fuel for the tractor. She hopes this loan will help improve their business.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and fuel for the tractor.

loans.name: Visitacion

texts.en:
Visitacion is a married woman with two children. She is 43 years old and has had a food selling business for almost 10 years. She sells food like peanut butter, good for sandwich spreads, and food flavorings. She has been in this business for 10 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP (~$75) a month.

She is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP to purchase additional ingredients such as peanuts, sugars and cooking oil, and also plastic jars for packaging. In the future, Visitacion hopes to sell more food products in order to generate more income to save for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase peanuts, sugars and cooking oil, and also plastic jars for packaging.

loans.name: Esterlita

texts.en:
Esterlita is a married woman with 4 children. She is 42 years old and is a farmer working in the town of Veruela, Agusan Del Sur. She and her husband own and till the land where they grow rice crops. Their current earnings are about 5,000 PHP (~$125) per month from farming.

Esterlita has requested a loan that she plans to use to purchase fertilizers and fuel for the tractor. She said she is thankful for this loan because she really needs to fund their farm and earn more for the family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and fuel for the tractor.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: o buy bowls, dishes, plastic buckets and teakettles.

loans.name: Aigul's Group

texts.en:
Aigul is the leader of her borrowing group. She is 34 and married to a locksmith. Together with her husband she is raising four children, all of whom attend school. In order to earn additional money to meet family needs, Aigul breeds and raises livestock. She started this activity three years ago with an initial investment of 10,000 soms. With the profits gained from raising livestock Aigul has been able to improve her family’s living conditions. For example, she purchased a fridge and kitchen furniture. With this loan she wants to purchase more livestock for breeding. In the future Aigul hopes to earn enough to be able to purchase a house for her family.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Janice

texts.en:
Janice is 28 years old, married, and has two children aged 10 and 6. She is a farmer who tills a land in the town of Veruela, Agusan Del Sur. She has been growing rice for 10 years and now earns about 6,000 Philippine pesos per month from farming.

Janice plans to use this loan to purchase more seed and fertilizer, and to buy fuel for her tractor. She says she is thankful to have the farm because it helps her earn the money needed to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase seed and fertilizer, and to buy fuel for a tractor

loans.name: Kao

texts.en:
Kao lives in Ornlong Veng in Siem Reap Province. To make a living, she sells different kinds of meatballs in her community from her motor-cart. From this, she could make around 3 USD in profit a day. She has a life partner in her husband who is a rice farmer. Besides her meatball-selling business, Kao often helps support her husband in the farming business as well.

Her motorbike, which she uses as a vehicle to transport her meatballs to sell, is broken, and this is an obstacle for her in running her business. Therefore, Kao is requesting funding from Kiva in order to purchase a new motorcycle to replace the old broken one.

loans.use: to purchase a new motorcycle to replace her old broken one.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 43 years old, married, and has two children aged 21 and 17. She earns a living through farming and assists her husband in managing their rice field. She helps till their land, plant rice seed, and keep the farm free of weeds and pests. With this loan, she plans to purchase seed, fertilizer, and fuel for their tractor.

In the future, Jocelyn hopes their farm and living conditions will improve.

loans.use: to purchase seed, fertilizer, and fuel for a tractor

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cosmetics, mayonnaise and three bags of sugar

loans.name: Uulkan's Group

texts.en:
Uulkan is the leader of her borrowing group. Eight years ago she opened a kiosk, where she started to sell foodstuffs and detergents. Her monthly profit is 7,000 soms. 

Uulkan is 45 and married to an electrician, whose monthly salary is 12,000 soms. She and her husband have three children -- two sons and a daughter. The family lives in Tamchi, a small village near Isykul Lake. The first son makes money by renting parasols on a local beach, the second son is a student, their daughter helps Uulkan in running the family business.

Uulkan applied for this loan because she needs more money to buy foodstuffs for her kiosk, with the hopes of increasing her turnover and sales at the kiosk. In the future Uulkan hopes she might earn enough to open a grocery store of her own.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase foodstuffs to sell at a kiosk

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy paints, cement, door locks, zinc and plywood.

loans.name: Apiyza's Group

texts.en:
Apiyza is the leader of this group. She is 27 years old, married to a constructor, and has five children, three of whom attend school.  In order to earn money to meet their daily needs, the family cultivates agricultural products. Apiyza is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizers for farming. The loan will help her finish the field work on time. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly), and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers.

loans.name: Srun

texts.en:
Srun (pictured here) is a weaver, while her husband is a farmer and also runs a battery-charging business at home. Srun is asking for a loan of $500 to assist her husband’s farming business by purchasing a water pumping machine.

The couple lives on an island in the Mekong River. They have one son and two daughters.

loans.use: to assist her husband’s farming business by purchasing a water pumping machine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more beer and drinks for sale

loans.name: Sitha

texts.en:
Sitha (pictured here) sells finished silk fabrics, while her husband is a teacher. 

She previously asked for a Kiva loan to buy a motorbike for her son to drive to school, but she uses the motorbike to carry finished silk fabrics for sale. 

So, she is now requesting a loan to purchase another motorbike for her son, who is attending a pedagogy class, to drive to school.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for her son to drive to school

loans.name: Ranny

texts.en:
Ranny (shown in the picture) and her husband, Choeun, live along National Road Number Six, about 18 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 2000 and have one son and two daughters. One child is in school and other two are still young. 

Ranny grows mushrooms. In addition, she sells meatballs, boiled eggs and roasted beef. She is asking for a loan of $500 to repair the kitchen where she cooks.

loans.use: to repair the kitchen where she cooks.

loans.name: Topchugul's Group

texts.en:
Topchugul is a member of this group. She is 51 and married to a constructor. Together with her husband she is bringing up two sons and a daughter. The older son went to work in Russia, the daughter studies at school and the second son is preschool age (younger than 7). 

Two years ago, with an initial investment of 3,000 soms, Topchugul started to sell cookies and stationery near the school. In this way she earns about 3,000 soms per month. She applied for the loan because she needs additional funds to rent a container for selling her wares. Topchugul wants to start selling school uniforms at the market. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to rent a container for selling her wares

loans.name: Chanthoeurn

texts.en:
Chanthoeurn (pictured here) is 26 years old and her husband, Piset is also 26 years old.  They have been married since 2009 and just had a baby. They live in a suburb of Phnom Penh.

Chanthoeurn and her husband are garment workers.  She is asking for her first loan of 1,000 USD to buy a motorbike to drive to work.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike to drive to work.

loans.name: Sanabar's Group

texts.en:
Sanabar is the treasurer of this group.  She is 55 and married to a farmer. Together with her husband she raising two sons.  The first son went to work in Russia and the second son is in school.  In order to earn money to meet the daily needs the family, she cultivates agricultural products and breeds livestock. 

Five years ago, Sanabar, with an initial investment of 4,000 soms purchased four goats and then she resold them at a higher price after fattening them. In this way she earns an additional 2,300 soms per month.  Sanabar needs additional money to start repairing the house and for this purpose she applied for the loan.  She hopes that the loan will help her to realize the plans. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to repair the house

loans.name: Risalat's Group

texts.en:
Risalat is the leader of this group.  She is 47 years old and married to a farmer.  Together with her husband she has raised three daughters and two sons. Two older daughters are married and they live separately with their families and the other children are students.

In 2009, Risalat, with an initial investment of 30,000 soms, started to sell clothing at the market.  At the moment her business is doing well and she earns about 15,000 soms per month.  Risalat applied for the loan because she needs additional financial funds for purchasing more clothing.  She wants to increase the inventory turnover of her business.  In the future with the profits gained from selling the clothes, Risalat hopes to build a house for her sons.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing for trade

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a photography and wood lamination business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 29500 through NWTF to purchase a laser printer to be used for her photography and wood lamination business.

Helen has been in this business for 9 years. She earns additional income from farming rice.

Helen has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She hopes to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase a  laser printer to be used in her business

loans.name: Lazaro

texts.en:
Lazaro is 47 years old and married.  He is the father of 4 children.  His oldest child is 21 years old and the youngest is 12.

Lazaro is a farmer working in the town of Sta. Josefa, Agusan Del Sur.  He tills his own land where he grows rice crops.  Lazaro works hard to keep his farm productive.  He also manages a small backyard piggery.  He raises hogs to sell.

Lazaro has requested a loan to purchase farm fertilizer and pig feed.  He hopes for his ventures to prosper.

loans.use: to purchase farm fertilizer and pig feed

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is 52 years old and married with 4 children. Elena works very hard to provide for them.

Elena runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell in her store.

Elena has been in this business for 5 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, sugar, soap, biscuits, etc. 

In the future, Elena would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 41 year old married man and the father of 6 children.  Has been working as a grocery store owner since 2000.  Ahmad opened in 2000 his store in Ain where he sells food and beverages in addition to tobacco.
 
Ahmad is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua for the first time in order to prepare himself for the Holy Ramadan Season, where people start to get prepared early through buying and storing cereals, milk, rice, sugar and a lot of vegetables.

Ahmad is a man with a strong personality and good communication skills.  He loves his family and village and villagers a lot and seeks the best for all.  Ahmad hopes to increase his business turnover and to improve it, and to own a new shop next to the main road.

loans.use: To get ready for Holy Ramadan

loans.name: Ma. Dina

texts.en:
Ma. Dina is 43 years old and married with 6 children.

Ma. Dina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buy and sell nipa in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 25000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell. A nipa is a native house that has traditionally been constructed with bamboo tied together and covered with a thatched roof using nipa/anahaw leaves.

Ma. Dina has borrowed and repaid 12 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the buy and sell nipa for 7 years and also earns an income from fish and shrimp vending.

Ma. Dina aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Khariton

texts.ru:
26 летний Харитон проживает в городе Севане вместе с родителями, женой и ребенком. Отец Харитона не работает из-за состояния здоровья, мать Харитона преподает в школе, а жена находиться в декретном отпуске. 
Харитон окончил индустриально-технологический техникум и по профессии он бухгалтер. С 2008 года он работал дистрибьютором в частной фирме, а с февраля 2011 года он сам зарегистрировался как частный предприниматель. Харитон арендовал небольшой магазин и организовал в нем торговлю продовольственными товарами. Т.к. зарплата матери Харитона не велика, почти вся прибыль от магазина идет на содержание семьи.
Харитону необходим кредит на сумму 1,000,000 драм на покупку макаронных изделий, круп, кофе, чая, кондитерских изделий, соков и т.д. для своего магазина.
texts.en:
Khariton is twenty six years old and lives in the town of Sevan together with parents, his wife and child. Khariton's father does not work due to his health condition and Khariton's mother is a teacher in school. His wife is now on a leave of absence.

Khariton graduated from an industrial-technical college and is an accountant by profession. Since 2008 he has been working as a distributor in a private firm and since February of 2011 he had registered as a business owner. Khariton rented out a small store and organized selling of groceries. Because Khariton's salary is not big almost all the income from the business goes towards supporting the family.

Khariton needs a loan in the amount of 1,000,000 dram to buy pasta products, cereals, coffee, tea, confections, juices and other items for his store.

loans.use: to buy pasta products, cereals, coffee, tea, confectionery, juices, and other items for his store

loans.name: Liezle

texts.en:
As a married parent of 4 children, Liezle works hard to support her family.

She has used clothing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling jewelry. Liezle is borrowing PHP 16500 through NWTF to purchase more stock of used clothing to sell.

Liezle has been sustaining her business activities through her past 16 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase more stock of used clothes to sell

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 51 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has three children.
 
Teresita has a pig-raising business and she sells mature pigs. She has had this business for four years. 

She requested a loan for PHP 12,000 to buy animal feed for the pigs.

Teresita has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Teresita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy animal feed for the pigs.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is 60 years old and married with 3 children.

Josefina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock for her general store.

Josefina has borrowed and repaid 15 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from food vending and rice retailing.

Josefina aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock to sell

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 49 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has two children. 

Gina has a shop that sells snacks, beverages and canned goods. She has had this business for five years. 

She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Gina has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Gina hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Minda

texts.en:
Minda is 60 years old and married with five children.

She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. Minda is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pig. Minda has been pig fattening for 35 years and also earns additional income from tailoring.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pig.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Lourdes works hard to support her family.

She has a restaurant business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising livestock, including cows, pigs, and goats. Lourdes is borrowing 25,000 PHP through NWTF to buy ingredients for her restaurant business.

Lourdes has been sustaining her business activities through her past 17 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream of saving enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her restaurant business.

loans.name: Hanaa

texts.en:
Hanaa. 44, is married and has two children.

She has been selling clothes for 20 years. She started her own business in 2002 and sells clothes from her house to help her husband cover their expenses and increase their income, and to make a better living for her children.

Hanaa works hard to satisfy her customers. She insists on purchasing whatever they need and desire to keep them loyal and happy.

Hanaa is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua and it will be her seventh loan as an Al Majmoua borrower with a good history. With the loan, she will  introduce cosmetics and perfumes and start selling them in addition to clothes.

Hanaa hopes to keep improving her business more and more in the future and to provide her children with the best healthy and secure living.

loans.use: To add cosmetics and perfume to her clothing sales business.

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Merlita is 52 years old and married. She has seven children. The oldest child is 31 and the youngest is 13. Five of her children still go to school.

Merlita is a farmer. She and her husband own and till land in Sta. Josefa, Agusan Del Sur. They grow rice to sell to rice traders. Merlita works hard to support her family and send her children to school. 

She requested a loan to help fund their farm. She plans to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. Merlita hopes this loan will help improve their farm.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Bernardita

texts.en:
Bernardita is 54 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has two children.
 
Bernardita has a retail shop that sells snacks, breads and canned goods. She has had this business for eight years. 

She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy beverages, snacks and noodles.

Bernardita is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Bernardita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy beverages, snacks and noodles to sell.

loans.name: Abduzarif

texts.ru: Абдузариф проживает в районе Руми. Женат. У него трое детей. Он имеет среднее образование. Более пяти лет Абдузариф печет  лепёшки и продаёт их. Кредит берет для закупа муки.
texts.en: Abduzarif lives in the region of Rumy. He is married and has three children. He has secondary education. Abduzarif has been making and selling flat breads for more than five years. He is taking the loan to buy flour.

loans.use: to buy flour

loans.name: Emelinda

texts.en:
Emelinda is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has four children. 

Emelinda has a beauty shop that provides hair dressing and coloring. She has had this business for five years. 

She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy materials needed for the beauty parlor.

Emelinda is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Emelinda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for the beauty parlor.

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is a 28-year-old woman and she owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. 

She has been selling baby items for five years and she generated her initial capital to start her current business from her previous job as a teacher. 

Her challenge is bad debtors and her vision is owning a baby center.

Rehema needs the loan to buy baby items to sell.

loans.use: To buy baby items.

loans.name: Rosalita

texts.en:
Rosalita is 55 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has three children.
 
Rosalita has a food shop that sells rice and cheese cakes. She has had this business for 10 years. 

She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy raw ingredients needed for rice and cheese cakes.

Rosalita is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Rosalita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients needed for rice and cheese cakes.

loans.name: Fely

texts.en:
Fely  is 53 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has two children.
 
Fely  has a retail shop that sells Avon and Natasha products. She has had this business for a year. 

She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy additional stocks from Avon and Natasha.

Fely is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Fely hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock from Avon and Natasha.

loans.name: Leah

texts.en: Leah is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a clothing-sales business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to purchase more inventory for her business. Leah has been in this business for 5 years and earns additional income from food vending. She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Hilaria

texts.en:
Hilaria, 53, lives with her three children in Cabisera 5, San Antonio, Ilagan, Isabela. Her husband helps her in their farming business. According to them, helping each other is one of the ways they show how they love each other, and despite problems that come to them, they know how to face things. 

Hilaria is dedicated to planting and harvesting rice and corn for sale. She earns a net income of PHP 5,000 monthly.

She requests the loan of PHP 15,000 to buy fertilizer and corn seeds to grow. Support from the loan will help her economically to improve production and meet her needs. 

Her dream is to have a house of her own in five years and to continue moving forward with her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and corn seed.

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en: As a married parent of ten children, Annabelle works hard to support her family. She has a shell crafts business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from an Avon dealership.  Annabelle is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy materials like shells for her business. She has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF and hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to extend her business.

loans.use: to buy materials like shells for her crafts business

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To renovate his shop from outside and inside, to make shelves and to add more inventory.

loans.name: Bienvinido

texts.en:
Bienvinido is 33 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with two children. 
Bienvinido has a shop that sells green bananas. He has had this business for one year. He requested a loan for 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy additional stock of green bananas.
Bienvinido is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Bienvinido hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of green bananas

loans.name: Ma. Elma

texts.en: Ma.Elma is 34 years old and married with one child. She works hard to provide for her family by running a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy items like biscuits and groceries to sell in her store. She has borrowed and repaid 8 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her store for 5 years and also earns income from making and selling food. Ma.Elma wants to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items like biscuits and groceries to sell in her sari-sari store

loans.name: Rosela

texts.en: Rosela is 59 years old and married with 8 children. She has earned a living by running a pig-fattening business in the Philippines for 20 years and earns additional income from buying and selling charcoal and by fishing. Rosela is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 26 years old, married and has two children.

Hussein has owned a generator since 2010.  He distributes power lines for houses. He has more than three years experience, a good reputation and he is well known in his area.

He is requesting a $3000 loan to build a soundproof room for the generator and to purchase additional diesel tanks. He is aiming to gain more profits so he can improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To build a soundproof room for a generator and to purchase additional diesel tanks.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with seven children. 
Rosalina has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and biscuits. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan for 11,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.
Rosalina has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Rosalina hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy 15 bags of maize for grinding into flour.

loans.name: Tirso

texts.en:
Tirso is 49 years old, married, and lives with his family in San Antonio, Ilagan, Isabela. His wife is a domestic helper. Tirso and his three grown children help each other to manage their farm in order to save money for their future.

Tirso is a farmer who grows rice and corn. He also owns a mini store. He makes his purchases at Ilagan market and makes his sales in the community.

Tirso is requesting a loan of 14,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to purchase fertilizer and pesticides for his farm. The support of this loan will help him to financially cover his needs. His dream is for his family to have their own house and lot.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and pesticides for his farm.

loans.name: Letty

texts.en:
Letty is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. 

Letty has a retail shop that sells canned goods, noodles, and breads. She has had this business for three years. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy breads, canned goods, and biscuits.

Letty is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Letty hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy breads, canned goods, and biscuits.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 37 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 
Gina is providing jeepney services with her husband as the driver. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy tools and utilities needed for the service.
Gina is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Gina hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy tools and utilities needed for the service

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 20 years old, single and lives with two family members, one of whom works.

Mohamad has had a barber shop since 2006. He has more than eight years experience and has a deep understanding of the local consumer. He is well known in his area.

He is requesting a $1350 loan to renovate his shop. He is optimistic about his business development and hopes that the coming years will continue to bring him positive growth.

loans.use: To renovate his shop.

loans.name: Myrlyn

texts.en:
Myrlyn is 30 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 
Myrlyn has a retail shop that sells fish like sardines and milk fish. She has had this business for four years. She requested a loan for 5,000 Philippine pesos to buy fish to sell.
Myrlyn is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Myrlyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell

loans.name: Nemer

texts.en:
Nemer is a 24-year-old single man from Chtaura. He has been working in a Hooka Cafe since 2009.  A hooka is "an oriental tobacco pipe with a long, flexible tube that draws the smoke through water contained in a bowl". He also delivers hookas to homes and businesses upon request, since renting hookas is becoming popular these days.

Nemer is a man with a good reputation. He is liked by most of his customers who are mostly friends, relatives and neighbors. Nemer is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua-Kiva partner for the first time to increase the number of hookas he owns, and to buy additional plastic tables and chairs to increase the number of customers accepted at the shop.

Nemer also works on a school bus in the autumn-winter season to increase his income.  He works hard to seek a better living. To improve his business more, part of the loan will be invested in doing necessary maintenance to his van. Nemer hopes to improve his business more and more in the future through buying a new big school bus.

loans.use: To increase the number of his Hookas and to buy additional chairs and tables to his cafe

loans.name: Akram

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 49 years old, married and has four children.

Akram has had a barber shop since 1995, where he offers shaving and massage services. He has a lot of experience and a good reputation. His shop is situated in a crowded area so there are a good number of customers passing by.

He is requesting a $3000 loan to renovate his shop and to make a new ceiling for it. He is aiming to gain more profits so he can improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To renovate his shop and to make a new ceiling for it.

loans.name: Marjorie

texts.en:
Majorie is 21 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. 

Majorie has a retail shop that sells fish like sardines & mackerel. She has had this business for two years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy fish to sell.

Majorie is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Majorie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell

loans.name: Hayat

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. She is 38 years old, married and has five children.

Hayat has been a tailor since 2000. She makes and repairs women’s clothing. She has a deep understanding of the local consumer, good experience and is well known in her area.

She is requesting a $2,400 loan to buy a new tailoring machine and to add more inventories (tissues, buttons). She is aiming to gain more profits so she can improve her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To buy a new tailoring machine and to add more inventories like tissues and buttons

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy hairdressing epuipment

loans.name: Francisco

texts.en:
Francisco, 48, lives in the rural village of San Antonio. He is a simple man who lives in his own house with his wife. They have been married for 25 years but lived together for 12 years before tying the knot. They have two wonderful children. Francisco began growing rice and corn 25 years ago and puts into practice everything he learned from his parents. He plants and harvests rice and corn twice a year.

What he enjoys most about his work is taking care of his crops because he feels like he has done a good job each harvest time when he goes to sell the rice and corn in town. He has two carabaos that he uses to plow the fields. He plows for others who pay him extra money, around PHP 180 per day. He is now preparing to plant the rice and corn and he is hoping to get good results. He is requesting a loan of PHP 29,000. The loan will be used to buy various sacks of organic fertilizer to begin planting his rice and corn.

He hopes to have good earnings from this in order to improve his farm. He also wants to find technology to be more efficient and to improve the conditions of his home and farm. He wants to continue planting crops in the future.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer for his farm

loans.name: Bon Berger Group

texts.fr: La cliente Odette, vice présidente du groupe d’affaire « Bon berger »,  est entrepreneur, âgée de 45 ans, mariée, mère de 6 enfants, tous étudient et d’autres ont déjà leurs propres foyers. Elle est  vendeuse de beignet et sociétaire d’un publiphone. Son mari est un technicien électricien indépendant. Elle vend ses marchandises au long de la route principale Goma-Sake, à proximité d’une buvette. Il y a 10 ans révolus qu’elle exerce ces activités. Cependant, elle vient de réaliser  6 cycles avec le crédit de Hekima. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir  de s’approvisionner  avec  2 sacs de farine, 2 bidons d’huile végétales, 50 kg de sucres, les unités flash de 100 dollars rechargeables.  En plus, elle ambitionne scolariser ses enfants et acheter une parcelle pour y construire confortablement.  La cliente remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres femmes exclues de banque classique. Il sied de signaler que le groupe d’affaire « Bon berger » est majoritairement féminins.
texts.en: The client Odette, vice president of the "Good Shepherd" business group is a 45 year old married entrepreneur, and the mother of 6 children all of whom are educated and some of whom already have their own households.  She sells fritters and is a co-owner of a payphone.  Her husband is an independent electrical technician.  She sells her merchandise along the principal route, Goma-Sake, near a refreshment are.  She has run this business for ten years.  She has fulfilled six loans cycles through loans from Hekima.  This new loan will allow her to stock up with 2 bags of flour, 2 drums of vegetable oil, 50 kg of sugar, and rechargeable calling cards in 100 dollar units.  Moreover, she hopes to educated her children and buy a plot of land to construct a home comfortably.  The client thanks Hekima for its actions to help poor women who are normally excluded by classic banks.  It may be noted that the "Good Shepherd" business group is made up, for the most part, of women..

loans.use: to buy 2 bags of flour, 2 drums of vegetable oil, 50 kg of sugar and rechargeable cards cards in 100 dollars units.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is 54 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with seven children. 

Cristina has a retail shop that sells fish like sardines & mackerel. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy fish to sell.

Cristina is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Cristina hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell

loans.name: Demtila

texts.en:
Demtila is 45 years old and married. She has six children who depend on her. She is a businesswoman operating a quarry. She has been in this business for the past ten years.

Demtila knew about KADET through other women registered in her area of residence. She paid her previous loan successfully, without complication. This is her fifth loan from KADET LTD, and she wants to use the loan to employ temporary workers to aid her business. 

She hopes to venture into other businesses and improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: to employ temporary workers to aid her business

loans.name: Elena

texts.en: Elena is 55 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. Elena has a retail shop that sells fish, like sardines. She has had this business for four years. She requested a loan of 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy fish to sell. Elena is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Elena hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell

loans.name: Jeremiah

texts.en:
Jeremiah is 30 years old and married. He has three children, two of whom are in school. He does mixed farming, rearing sheep and goats and also cultivating wheat, which he has been doing for the past eight years.

Jeremiah learned about KADET LTD through a KADET staff member. He paid his first loan successfully and applied for a second loan, which he plans to spend part of on farming and the remainder on purchasing more animals.

He hopes to make a profit and use it to educate his children. He dreams of expanding his business.

loans.use: to purchase more animals

loans.name: Betty

texts.en: Betty is 44 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. Betty has a retail shop that sells beauty products from Avon and Natasha. She has had this business for 22 years. She requested a loan of 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy additional Avon and Natasha products. Betty is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Betty hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional Avon and Natasha products

loans.name: Felix

texts.en:
Felix, age 31, is married and has two children. He has been farming for the past four years. Felix is a humble client. He heard about KADET through other clients registered in his area of dwelling. This will be his first loan with KADET, and he intends to spend it on preparing the land for farming and purchasing maize seeds.

He intends to plough back the profit generated into the farm and dreams of having a big farm. He can do more if provided with resources.

loans.use: to prepare the land for farming and purchase maize seeds

loans.name: Phylis

texts.en:
Phylis has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last seven years. She is 47 years old, single and the mother of three school-going children.  

She was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers and this will be her second loan.  She paid her previous loan of KES.10,000 well and in good time.  She plans to use the loan to buy potato seeds and fertilizer. She will later sell her crop to the local market as she practices small-scale farming.

In the future, Phylis hopes to become a leading farmer in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en: Marissa is 26 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. Marissa has a retail shop that sells fish like sardines & mackerel. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy fish to sell. Marissa is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Marissa hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell

loans.name: Lom

texts.en:
Lom, a 36-year-old farmer, is married to a tractor driver, and their combined income is $4 per day. She has five children, three of whom are studying, while the other two work in a factory, earning $6 per day. Every month, Lom has to spend $28 on food, $10 on school fees, $10 on transportation, and $23 on other expenses.

She would like to request a loan of $500 to buy pigs and cattle to breed in order to sell their offspring because her income as a farmer is inadequate to support her family. Lom also plans to plant corn and vegetables to sell in the market to earn more income to support her children's studies.

loans.use: to buy pigs and cattle to breed in order to sell their offspring.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to plough his land.

loans.name: Haydar

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 35 years old, married and has three children.

Haydar has owned a car repair workshop since 2000. He has a lot of experience, a good reputation and he is well known in his area.

He is requesting a $2,400 loan to renovate his workshop and to make a sliding door. He is aiming to gain more profits so he can improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To renovate his workshop and to make a sliding door.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fabric for her husband to make clothes to sell.

loans.name: Ines

texts.en:
Ines is 61 years old and is married with five children. Ines has a shop where she sells home care products,food supplements and more from Keziah Marketing Inc. She has been in business for ten years. 

Ines is a new member of HSPFI. She has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy additional food supplements.

In the future, Ines hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional food supplements.

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Henry is a twenty-two-year-old hardworking man who rents a house in Kasese, Uganda. Three years ago he started as a taxi conductor and now is a driver. His hardship is traffic officers who always charge him unfairly.

Henry wants a loan to buy a motorcycle for his own transport business. His vision is to buy a motorcycle and a motor vehicle.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is 51 years old and she is a responsible mother to her three children. She lives close to her parents’ house in San Antonio. The area where she lives is rural and her main activity is in the agriculture sector.

Maria has been planting crops for a living. She sees to the sale of the rice and corn in the markets. She has several years of experience in this business. This business generates a good income for her.

Maria is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy fertilizer such as manure and seeds to grow for her farm.

Maria is a home-loving person and is respected by the people that know her. They describe her as friendly and hard-working in her community.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer such as manure and seeds

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy old motorbikes to resell

loans.name: Wafaa

texts.en:
Wafaa is a 48-year-old widow, living and working in Tyre. She has no children, and most of her family members are dead. She has been selling food and beverages since 2004 because after her husband's death, she found no one to take care of her and help in her living. Wafaa says life has been cruE. to her, since it took most of her beloved ones and left her alone struggling to fight for her living.

Because she had very little capital to start her business, Wafaa faced some obstacles. Wafaa is requesting her second loan from Al Majmoua in order to increase her store's stock before Ramadan.

Ramadan is Islam’s holy month. During the ninth month of the Muslim calendar devout Muslims fast from dawn until sunset. Ramadan originated during a summer month. The Arabic term “ramadan” (known in Turkey and Persia as “ramazan”) originally meant "the hot month," from ramida, "to be burnt, scorched." Based on the Islamic lunar calendar, however, the start of Ramadan passes through all seasons in a cycle of about 33 years.

Most of her customers like dealing with her to encourage her more and more to improve her way of life. With Wafaa’s previous loan she improved her business a lot and is hoping to do so in the coming days with her new loan.

loans.use: to increase her store's stock before Ramadan.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is forty years old and married with six children. She has a shop where she sells fish like sardines and mackerel. She has been in business for three years.

Evelyn is a new member of HSPFI. She has requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy more fish to sell. In the future, Evelyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
Theresa is a forty-three-year-old married woman with three children. She owns a house in Kasese, Uganda.

Theresa has been in the poultry business for a year. This has enabled her to provide for basic needs for her family. Her challenge is expensive chicken feed.

Theresa needs a loan to pay for her children’s school fees. Her vision is to have a flock of at least 1,000 chickens and to buy more land.

loans.use: to pay for her children’s school fees.

loans.name: No

texts.en: No is a farmer. Her husband is an animal seller. Their income is $15 per day. She has two children, 12 and 9 years old. Both of the children are studying. Every month she has to spend $35 on food, $10 on school fees, $5 on house rental fee, and $5 on electricity. She would like to request a loan of $1,000 to buy cattle to sell. Before, her husband was only doing farming but the income was not good so he tried to find another career to do besides farming. Therefore, he started to buy and resell animals and he found he could make a good income. Her husband likes this career and will buy and resell more cattle if he has enough money to do it. She expects to send all of her children to study in the university when they grow up.

loans.use: To buy cattle to sell

loans.name: Nezinunula Group

texts.en:
Jackson wants a loan to buy another motorcycle for his business that he has been running for one year. At 40 years old, Jackson hails from Kyenjojo District in Uganda and is a father of six children. He lives with his children and their mother in a residential iron-roofed house. He started as a farmer and he saved money to buy a motorcycle to use in his transport business, commonly known as bodaboda. His dream is to educate his children and own at least three motorcycles.

He is a member of Nezinunula group where each member guarantees the other to access a loan.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle for his business

loans.name: Kimakut

texts.en:
Kimakut, 36 years old, is married with three children. He has been a mixed farmer for the last six years.

He was introduced to KADET by a registered client in his abode. This is his first loan, which he plans to use to purchase farm inputs i.e. fertilizers, seeds and chemicals. He intends to use part of the return from the loan to plow back into farming and part to repay the loan.

His dreams are to become a famous farmer in the area and to educate his kids to a higher level of education.

He an industrious man who struggles to achieve if funded.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs like seeds, fertilizers and chemicals

loans.name: Kan

texts.en: Kan, 54 year old, is a weaver. Her husband is a farmer. Their income is $6 per day. She has five children. None of the children is studying, but three are working in a factory. Every month she has to spend $43 on food, $5 on electricity, $15 on transportation, and $5 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $400 to buy agriculture material for sowing mushroom to sell so that she can make more income to support her family. She expects that all of her children will get a good job to do in the future and will be able to take care of themselves and her too.

loans.use: To buy agriculture material for sowing mushroom to sell

loans.name: Loyce

texts.en:
Loyce has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 10 years. She is 56 years old and married to Paul. They have three children who are in school.  

She was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers and this will be her third loan. She paid all her previous loans well and in good time.  She plans to use the loan to buy potato seeds and fertilizer and pay her casual workers to help her in planting.

In the future, she hopes to become a leading farmer in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Chinda

texts.en: Chinda, 40 year old, is a construction worker. Her husband is a chief of construction workers. Their income is $11 per day. She has four children and all of them are studying. Every month she has to spend $43 on food, $15 on transportation, $10 on school fees, and $5 on electricity. She would like to request a loan of $800 to buy pigs to feed at home and to sell. She will raise the pigs when she relaxes from construction work so that she can make more income to help all of her children to study well. She wants to repair her house to be more comfortable to stay.

loans.use: To buy pigs to feed and sell

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en: Mohamad is a 29 year-old married man and father of one child. He has worked at furniture making since July 2006. He is a man with a good reputation who is liked by customers and friends. To improve his business, Mohamad is going to buy a power generator, that will help him get his work done in a shorter period of time, with the same quality, because electricity is a major problem in his area. That's why Mohamad is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua for the first time. Mohamad is willing to work hard to provide his child with the best living and education, and stay healthy to assure that all his family's needs are met.

loans.use: To buy a power generator necessary for his business

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet is a married woman from Kyenjojo district. She is a Ugandan woman aged 39 who has owned a retail shop for 13 years and is also a farmer. A mother of six children, she dreams of educating her children and building a better house. She acquired her initial capital from operating a restaurant. Janet wants a loan to purchase sodas, beer, and salt to sell and to plough her land.

loans.use: to buy beer, soda and salt, and to plough land in preparation for the next season

loans.name: Sarum

texts.en: Sarum, 41 year old, sells groceries. Her husband is a motor taxi driver and their income is $8 per day. She has three children, all of them studying. Every month, she has to spend $40 on food, $5 on electricity, $5 on house rental, $15 on school fees, $12 on transportation and $6 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $400 to buy more grocery goods to sell. Before, her family only did farming. Sarum wanted to stay home to take care of the children, so she started selling stuff from home such as cakes and soft drinks. Now she is becoming successful, she wants to enlarge her store as soon as she has enough money.

loans.use: To buy grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Serina

texts.en: Serina is a very hard-working woman who practices mixed farming in Olokurto-Narok, Kenya. She has been in this business for over five years and earns a monthly profit of KES 5,000. She is 47 years old and married to Philip, also a farmer, and they have five children. She is applying for her second loan. She plans to use the part of the loan amount to buy farm isupplies like seeds and fertilizer. She intends to use the additional income from the proceeds of this loan to buy cattle for fattening and to pay her children's school fees. She hopes to develop her business and to be financially stable in the future

loans.use: to buy farm supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy timber and bananas to sell

loans.name: Savorn

texts.en: Savorn is 59 year old. She sells fertilizer, oil and cake with her husband. Their income is $5 per day. She has three children. One of the children is studying and other two are working with $5 per day for each. Every month she has to spend $75 on food, $15 on electricity, $30 on school fees, and $5 on transportation. She would like to request a loan of $1,000 to buy more fertilizer and oil to sell. She wants to enlarge her business when she has enough money. She plans to repair her house to be more comfortable to stay.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and oil to sell

loans.name: Aggrey

texts.en: Aggrey is a trader and a farmer who wants a loan to buy millet and Irish potatoes to sell. At 47 years old, Aggrey hails from Kyenjojo District and is a father of four children. He lives with his children together with their mother in a semi-permanent house. He has the challenge of proper storage of his food and his dream is to own a food store and educate his children. Aggrey needs the loan facility to buy millet and irish potatoes to sell.

loans.use: To buy millet and irish potatoes to sell.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last nine years. She is 37 years old and married to Peter. They have three school-going children.  

She was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers and this will be her third loan. She paid all her previous loans well and in good time.  She plans to use the loan to buy potato seeds and fertilizer, which she will sell at the local market.

In the future, Eunice hopes to become a successful farmer in the Ndunyu Njeru area

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter, 58 years old, has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 10 years. He does small-scale farming and sells all his produce in the local market.  

He was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers, and this will be his third loan. He paid all his previous loans well and in good time. He plans to use the loan amount to buy potato seeds and fertilizer, which he will sell at the local market. He will also use part of the amount to pay his casual worker.

In the future, Peter hopes to become a successful farmer in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer and pay for labor.

loans.name: Neltetian

texts.en:
Neltetian is a very hardworking woman. She has been farming for over three years and earns a monthly profit of 3,000 Kenyan shillings (KES). She is 24 years old and married; they have one child. She is applying for her first loan. She plans to use part of the loan amount to buy farm inputs like seeds and fertilizer and to pay for labor.

She intends to use the additional income from the proceeds of this loan to buy cattle for fattening and to pay her children's school fees.

She hopes to develop her business and to be financially stable in the future.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs like seeds and fertilizer and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase farm supplies and to acquire more animals

loans.name: Raya

texts.en:
Raya is a married woman with six children, all of whom graduated from school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and hospital bills. 

For the past four years, Raya has operated a poultry business, selling from home to butchers and restaurants. She faces major challenges regarding the high cost of transporting chicks and the lack of a ready market. Raya dreams of expanding her business to rear both broilers and layers. 

Raya plans to use this KES 20,000 loan to renovate her chicken stall and purchase more chicks. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To renovate her chicken stall and purchase more chicks.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 31-year-old single man who has been working in the car wash business since 2000. He stills enjoys his business and is willing to improve it more and more each day, which is why he requested a loan from Al Majmoua. He would like to buy a special dry cleaning machine that cleans the cars' furniture and seats quickly and perfectly.

Ali is a man with a good reputation. He had obstacles when starting his business since he didn't have a good number of clients to cover his expenses, but now he's well known and his income is almost fine. This is Ali's first experience with microfinance and he hopes it will be a good start for future expansion plans.

loans.use: To buy a new, improved dry cleaning machine for car interiors

loans.name: Marlene Sylvia

texts.fr:
Cliente de 34 ans, mariée et mère de 3 enfants dont l'age varie entre 3 et 17 ans. Étant sortie d'une école d'esthétique, après sa formation,en 2006, elle ouvre son propre salon de coiffure.
 Ses recettes sont de 8000 fr a 80.000frs par jour et ses clientes sont les jeunes filles et les femmes.

Avec le prêt reçu , elle va renforcer les crèmes de beauté de toute qualité, 2 pots de 5 kg de de frisants, 10l de démêlants, des tissages , des mèches et un appareil pour les de manucure et pédicure.

elle a pour ambition d'organiser et moderniser son salon de coiffure pour attirer plus de clientèle.
texts.en: The client is a 34 year old married woman, and the mother of three children between the ages of 3 and 17.  Having graduated from a beauty school, after her studies, in 2006 she opened her one hair salon.  Her revenues are between 8,000 and 80,000 frs per day and her clients are young girls and women.   With her loan, she will strengthen her supply of beauty creams of all qualities, and buy 2 five kilogram jars of two 5-kg jars of relaxant, 10 liters of conditioner, weaves and extensions, and a manicure/pedicure machine.  Her ambition is to organize and modernize her hair salon in order to attract a greater number of customers.

loans.use: to purchase two 5-kg jars of relaxant, 10 liters of conditioner, weaves and extensions, and hair clips.

loans.name: Brigitte Gisele

texts.fr:
Cliente de 36 ans, mariée et mère de 4 enfants dont l'age varie entre 2 et 17 ans.
Ayant obtenu son bac, après une année d'étude a l'université par manque de soutien , elle arrête ses etudes et se lance dans le commerce des grillades , tous les soirs , elle sort son  barbecue et fait ses grillades, elle vend en moyenne 25.000 a 45.000 fr par soirée.

A l'octroi de son prêt , elle va acheter 2 cartons de cuisse de poulet, 2 cartons de cotes de porcs, 2 cartons d'ailes et 1 carton de poisson de mer.

Tres entreprenante , elle use de plusieurs stratégies, la présentation de son étalage de vente,les prix de vente de ses produits font que ses produits soient très appréciés par ses potentiels clients.

A l'avenir elle en entrain de penser d'ouvrir un restaurant et avec ses benefices  venir en aide de sa famille.
texts.en: Thhe client is a 36 year old married woman, with 4 children between the ages of 2 and 17.  Having received her diploma, she studied at university for a year, but a lack of funds forced her to leave school and start up in the sale of grilled foods.  Each night, she gets out her barbecue, grills her meats, and sells them for an average revenue of 25,000 to 45,000 frs per evening.  In managing her loan, she is going to buy two boxes of chicken thighs, two boxes of pork sides, two boxes of chicken wings and one box of seafood.  A very entrepreneurial woman, she uses several selling strategies, including how she presents her food for sale and the prices of her products, which make her products very well-appreciated by potential customers.  In the future, she is in the process of thinking of opening her own restaurant and with the profits, coming to the aid of her family.

loans.use: to purchase two boxes of chicken thighs, two boxes of pork sides, and two boxes of chicken wings.

loans.name: Ana Rose

texts.en: Ana Rose is 21 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 1 child. Ana Rose has a retail shop where she sells vegetables such as cabbages. She has had this business for 3 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy sacks of vegetables. Ana Rose is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Ana Rose hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy sacks of vegetables

loans.name: Philip

texts.en: Philip has been practicing farming for the last twelve years. He is 33 years old, married, and supports three people. Philip was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be his first loan. He plans to use it to buy wheat seeds and fertilizer and to hire temporary field workers to assist him in planting. In the future, Philip hopes to become a leading farmer and educate his children.

loans.use: to buy wheat seeds and fertilizer and to hire temporary field workers

loans.name: Nickson

texts.en:
Nickson is a 28-year old married man with two children. He has been a wheat farmer for the past three years. Nickson has applied for his second loan with KADET Ltd., which he will use to buy farm supplies (wheat seeds and items for land preparation).

Nickson plans to use the profits generated from this loan to pay his children's school fees. He dreams of becoming a prominent farmer. Nickson is an assiduous man who works with effort to attain more, notwithstanding his limited resources.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 43 years old. He is married and is a father of six children. He is a farmer and he has been doing this for the last ten years. His farm is in a productive area, which has proved to be good for mixed farming.
