He learned about KADET LTD through a marketing campaign done by KADET staff in his area of residence. This will be his first loan, with which he is planning to buy farm supplies. He hopes to use the profit from this loan to build a new house and educate his children.

His hope and dream is to buy and build rental property. He is an energetic man who can do more if supported financially.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Cleofe

texts.en:
Cleofe is 25 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. 

Cleofe has a retail shop that sells vegetables like cabbages & carrots. She has had this business for two years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy additional stocks of vegetables.

Cleofe is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Cleofe hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional vegetables to sell

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick has been a farmer for the last 10 years. He is 27 years old and married. His wife is a housewife and they are blessed with two children. He learned about KADET from the marketing done by the KADET staff in his area of abode. Since this is his second loan. he plans to purchase farm supplies like seeds and fertilizers. He intends to use the returns from the loan to re-invest in farming and buy a bigger farm.

His dreams are to be the best and most well-known farmer in the area. He is an industrious man who can do well if funded.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies like seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Raphael

texts.en:
Raphael is age 29 and married. They have one child. He has been a wheat farmer for the past seven years. He learned about KADET through a registered client. He applied for his second loan, which he plans to use to purchase wheat seeds and fertilizers. He hopes to make a profit and use it to purchase sheep to fatten.

He dreams that when he reaches age 35, he will be stable and his children will live a better life.

loans.use: to purchase wheat seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 43 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with eight children. Josephine has a retail shop that sells vegetables like cabbages. She has had this business for 20 years. She requested a loan of 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy additional sacks of vegetables.

Josephine is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Josephine hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of vegetables.

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn is 28 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children. Roselyn has a retail shop where she sells snacks, biscuits and canned goods. She has had this business for 2 years. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods and snacks.

Roselyn is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Roselyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods and snacks

loans.name: Sayagie

texts.en:
Sayagie, 36 years old, is married and has three children, all in school. He has been farming on his own piece of land for the last six years.

Sayagie learned about KADET from credit officers. This will be his first loan, which he plans to use to purchase farm supplies such as seeds and fertilizers. He hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to expand his farming activity from small scale to commercial farming.

Sayagie's dream is to do large scale farming and attain financial independence. He is a hardworking man who is determined to achieve his set goals.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies such as seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson, 30 years old, is married and the father of two children. He has been farming for the last five years. His farm is in a productive area which has proved to be good for wheat farming. Wilson learned about KADET through KADET staff in his area of residence. This will be his second loan, which he plans to use to prepare for wheat farming.

Wilson hopes to use the profit from this loan to acquire more land for farming to increase his wheat production and educate his children. His hopes and dreams are to become a large scale farmer, buy a bigger piece of land and build a plot. Wilson is a young and energetic man who can do more if supported financially.

loans.use: to prepare for wheat farming

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Elena

texts.en: Elena is 40 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 1 child. Elena has been raising pigs for 1 year. She has requested a loan of PHP 11,000 to buy pig feed for the young and mother pigs. Elena has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Elena hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy pig feed

loans.name: Paquito

texts.en:
Paquito has a shop that sells bread, canned goods, detergents and snacks. He is 54 years old and lives in the Philippines.  He is married with three children.  Paquito has had this business for four years.  He requested a loan of 11,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy bread, biscuits and canned goods.

Paquito has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Paquito hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy bread, biscuits and canned goods.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs (such as fertilizers and seeds) and light equipment.

loans.name: Janelyn

texts.en:
Janelyn is 28 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. 

Janelyn has a shop that sells canned goods, biscuits & snacks. She has had this business for two years. She requested a loan of PHP 9,000 to buy breads, biscuits & beverages.

Janelyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Janelyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy breads, biscuits & beverages

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 28-year-old, single man from Tyre. He has been working in construction, specializing in painting homes and offices for 11 years, but he started his own business in 2008.

Ahmad is a hard worker. He works on improving his business through renewing his tools and searching for new themes and painting techniques, to fulfill his customer's needs and desires.

Ahmad is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua for the second time in order to renew his tools and to pay for his electrical home appliances that he is buying for the house that he's preparing to get married in soon.

His previous loan had a positive impact on his business and social life and, at the same time, he was a borrower in good standing. Ahmad is devoted to his business. That's why he works hard to update it with every idea he finds. He hopes to expand his business more in the future.

loans.use: To buy new tools and new home appliances

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy farm inputs, seeds and small materials

loans.name: Hamazasp

texts.en: Hamazasp is 59 years old and he lives in Geghamavan village, in the Sevan area with his wife. Hamazasp's son has seasonal work in Russia and Hamazasp's wife stays at home. Hamazasp worked at an illuminating glass factory as a senior guard for 11 years. After that, he bred pigs, and since 2004, he has been engaged in raising cattle. His wife helps him in animal breeding. They work very hard from early morning until late evening. Thus, they support themselves. This is Hamazasp's fourth loan from Nor Horizon and now he needs a 1,100,000 AMD loan to buy a large lot of fodder and to buy one more cow for his farm. His future income Hamazasp intends to spend for renewing his pig breeding business.

loans.use: To buy a large lot of fodder and to buy one more cow

loans.name: Kareem

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 39 years old, married and has five children. Kareem has has a shop selling shoes for women, men and kids since 2008. He has a deep understanding of local consumer needs. He has a good reputation and is well known in his area.

Kareem is requesting a $2400 loan to renovate his shop. He is aiming to gain more profits to improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to renovate his shop.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use:
Achat  d’intrants, semences  et petits matériels.
to purchase agricultural inputs, seeds, and small tools

loans.name: Sop Mame Diarra Bousso Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Sop Mame Diarra Bousso est créé depuis le 10 décembre 2010,il est composé de 34 femmes qui habitent le même quartier et s'activent dans la couture, teinture, la restauration et le petit commerce.


Madame Sokhna est la présidente du Banc Villageois, elle est mariée mère de quatre enfants et a en charge sa mère; elle est couturière et mène aussi une activité de petit commerce avec une bonne expérience de 26 ans. Elle est debout à droite sur la photo et a levé la main gauche.

Elle achète ses marchandises ( habits,perles,bracelets, colliers...) dans les villes et vend partout où il y a des cérémonies religieuses de grande envergure et dans les marchés hebdomadaires.


Elle souhaite avec son crédit renforcer son commerce afin de gagner plus de revenus.



Elle prend en charge la scolarité, la nourriture, l'habillement et la santé des enfants et de sa mère.
texts.en:
The Sop Mame Diarra Bousso Solidarity Group was established on December 10, 2010.  It is made up of 34 women who live in the same neighborhood and who work in dressmaking, dyeing, running restaurants, and as retailers.

Madam Sokhna is the president of the Village Bank.  She is the married mother of four children and also looks after her mother.  She is a seamstress and also manages a small retail business with 26 years of experience.  She is the first on the right of the photograph, raising her left hand.

She purchases her merchandise (outfits, beads, bracelets, necklaces, etc.) in the cities and sells wherever there are large-scale religious ceremonies and in the weekly markets.

With this loan, she hopes to strengthen her business in order to earn greater profits.  She pays for the schooling, food, clothing, and health needs of her children and her mother.

loans.use: to purchase outfits, beads, bracelets, and necklaces for resale.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en:
Raquel is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. Raquel has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for two years. She requested a loan of 8,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, beverages and snacks.

Raquel has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Raquel hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages and snacks.

loans.name: Sop Mame Diarra Bousso Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Sop Mame Diarra Bousso du Banc Villageois Sop Sokhna Awa Balla est créé depuis le 21 septembre 2010, il est composé de douze femmes qui sont parentes et voisines; elles ont longtemps travaillé ensemble et leur principale activité est le petit commerce.


Madame Oumy âgée de 38 ans est la responsable du groupe, mariée mère de deux enfants, elle a une cousine en charge; elle mène une activité de petit commerce de légumes et de produits divers depuis longtemps. Elle est debout à droite sur la photo et est habillée en orange-vert avec un foulard jaune autour du cou.



Elle s'approvisionne en légumes, pagnes brodés et colliers chez les grossistes au marché central du village et revend sur place.


Son prêt lui permettra de renforcer son activité afin de se faire beaucoup de revenus.



Elle aide  son mari dans la gestion des dépenses de la famille et gère ses besoins personnels avec les bénéfices obtenus.
texts.en:
The Sop Mame Diarra Bousso Solidarity Group of the Sop Sokhna Awa Balla Village Bank, was established September 21, 2010.  It is made up of 12 women who are kin and neighbors.  They have worked together for a great deal of time, primarily as retailers.

Madam Ourny, aged 38, is the leader of the group.  She is married and looks after her two children and a cousin.  She has sold vegetables and various products for a very long time.  She is the first on the right of the photograph, wearing orange and green, with a yellow scarf around her neck.

She stocks up on vegetables, embroidered fabrics, and necklaces from the wholesalers in the central village market and resells them locally.

This loan will allow her to strengthen her business in order to make more in profits.  She assists her husband in managing the household expenses and manages her personal needs with her earned profits.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables and various products for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase agricultural inputs, seeds, and small tools.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 58 years old, married and has two children. Mohamad has owned a coffee shop since 1980. He inherited this business from his parent, so he has a deep understanding of local consumer needs and he is well known in his area.

Mohamad is requesting a $3000 loan to buy new furniture and a large television screen for his shop. He is aiming to gain more profit so he can improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy new furniture and a large television screen for his shop.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en: Erlinda is 58 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children. Erlinda has a shop where she sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for 2 years. She has requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages. Erlinda has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Erlinda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Ajarbu's Group

texts.en:
Ajarbu is the treasurer of this group. She is 43 years old and married to a builder. She and her husband are raising six children: two sons and four daughters.

Five years ago, Ajarbu’s husband received salary in the amount of 17,000 KGS, which the family used to purchase livestock. Since then, the family has been breeding livestock. By reselling the livestock after fattening, they earn an additional 2,000 KGS per month. Ajarbu hopes to obtain this loan because she needs money to purchase more livestock for breeding. In the future, she wants to purchase a piece of land for cultivating agricultural products. --- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Sop Sokhna Faty Issa Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Sop Sokhna Faty Issa du Banc Villageois Sop Sokhna Awa Balla est créé le 21 septembre 2010, il est composé de onze femmes qui habitent le même quartier et qui sont cousines; elles s'activent depuis longtemps dans le petit commerce.


Madame Momy la responsable est âgée de 35 ans, elle est mariée mère de trois enfants, elle s'active dans le petit commerce de légumes; sur la photo elle est debout à droite habillée en vert.


Elle achéte et revend ses légumes au marché central du village.


Son prêt lui permettra d'acheter périodiquement une bonne quantité et variété de légumes afin de satisfaire la clientèle et se faire beaucoup de revenus.


Elle souhaite avec ses bénéfices attendus augmenter son épargne et se prendre en charge, son mari gère les besoins familiaux.
texts.en:
The Sop Sokna Faty Issa solidarity group of the Sop Sokhna Awa Balla Villageois was created on September 21, 2010. It is composed of 11 women who live in the same neighborhood and are related; they have been working as vendors for a long time.

Ms. Momy, the group’s representative, is 35 years old. She is married and the mother of three. She sells vegetables. On the photo she stands on the right, dressed in a green outfit. She buys and resells vegetables and the central market of their village. Her loan will allow her to keep stocking up on a variety of vegetables in order to meet client demand and have a high sales volume. Thanks to the expected income, she would like to bolster her savings and to cover her personal needs. Her husband takes care of the household expenses.

loans.use: to buy vegetables for resale at the central marketplace

loans.name: Thamer

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 34 years old, married and has one child. Thamer has owned a bakery since 1995. He makes bread and pastries. He has long experience in this field. His bakery is situated in a crowded area, so there are a good number of customers passing by. He has a good reputation.

Thamer is requesting a loan of $3000 to pay the annual rent for his bakery. He is aiming to gain more profit so he can improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent for his bakery.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy farm inputs, seeds, and assorted supplies and equipment

loans.name: Sop Cheickh Modou Awa Balla Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Sop Cheikh Modou Awa Balla du Banc Villageois de Sop Sokhna Awa Balla est créé depuis le 21 septembre 2010, il est composé de six femmes qui sont unies par des liens de parenté et de voisinage; elles s'activent dans le petit commerce et la couture.

Madame Maguette est âgée de 34 ans, elle est mariée sans enfant et pas de grandes charges; elle vient de démarrer son activité de vente de parfum et d'encens; elle est debout à droite sur la photo habillée en wax fleurettes vert olive.


Elle achète et revend ses parfums et encens dans le marché central du village.


Son prêt lui permettra d'acheter une bonne quantité de marchandises afin de se faire plus de revenus.

Avec ses bénéfices elle appui son mari dans les dépenses familiales, augmente son épargne et gère ses besoins personnels.
texts.en:
The solidarity group Sop Cheikh Modou Awa Balla of the Banc Villageois of Sop Sokhna Awa Balla was created on September 21, 2010. It comprises six women who are united by ties of kinship and community. They are active in small-scale commerce and in tailoring. 

Ms. Maguette is 34 years old and married. She has no children and no major expenses. She just started her business selling perfumes and incense. She is the one standing at the right in the photo and is dressed in ‘wax’ cloth with olive green flowers. She purchases her perfumes and incense and sells them at the central market of the village. 

Her loan will enable her to buy a good quantity of merchandise in order to make more income. With her profits, she is helping her husband with family expenses, increasing her savings, and meeting her own needs.

loans.use: to buy incense and perfume to be sold

loans.name: Ana Mae

texts.en: Ana Mae is 21 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 1 child. Ana Mae has a shop where she sells noodles and beverages. She has had this business for 4 years. She has requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy noodles, beverages and canned goods. Ana Mae has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Ana Mae hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy noodles, beverages and canned goods

loans.name: Inviolata

texts.en:
Inviolata is 40 years old and married, with two children. She runs a tailoring business in Kakamega, Kenya. Inviolata has had this business for four years and has three employees. She has borrowed a loan of KES 30,000 to buy materials for making clothes to sell to the local people.

Inviolata's future plan is to grow her business and employ more people. She also plans to buy a plot of land where she will build a house for her family. Inviolata describes herself as a visionary lady.

loans.use: to buy materials

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy seeds, small tools and agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase three cattle

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 38 years old.  He is married and a father of fifteen children.  He has been a farmer for the last four years. His farm is in a productive area which has proved to be good for wheat farming.

He learned about KADET through a marketing campaign done by KADET staff in his area. This will be his third loan.  It will be used to prepare his wheat farm. He hopes to use the profit from this loan to acquire more land for farming so that he can increase his wheat production and educate his children.

His hope and dream is to become a large-scale farmer and buy a bigger piece of land for a building plot.  He is a hard-working man who can do more if supported financially.

loans.use: to prepare his wheat farm

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase 10 lambs and fodder

loans.name: Janar's Group

texts.en:
Janar is the leader of this group. She is 38 and married to a truck driver. Together with her husband, she is bringing up two daughters.  The first daughter studies at university and the second daughter is newborn. In order to earn additional money to meet the family needs, Janar breeds livestock. She started this activity seven years ago with an initial investment of 10,000 soms. At the moment, her monthly profit from reselling livestock is 3000 soms.  With the loan, Janar wants to purchase more farm animals for breeding. In the future, with the profits gained from reselling livestock, Janar wants to purchase furniture in order to improve the family’s living conditions. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Rodha

texts.en:
Rodha is 24 years old. She has been farming on her own piece of land for the last three years.

Rodha learned about KADET from other women in a group already registered with KADET in her area of residence. This will be her first loan, which she plans to use to buy fertilizer and wheat and maize seeds. She hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to build a permanent house. Rodha's dreams are to be a prominent wheat farmer and better the family's living conditions. Rodha is an industrious woman who is determined to achieve her set objectives.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and wheat and maize seeds

loans.name: Nkirmpa

texts.en:
Nkirmpa, 42 years old, is married and the father of three children. He has been farming for the last ten years. His farm is in a productive area which has proved to be good for wheat farming.

Nkirmpa learned about KADET through a marketing campaign done by KADET staff in his area of residence. This will be his second loan, which he plans to use to prepare for wheat farming. He hopes to use the profit from this loan to acquire more land for farming to increase his wheat production and educate his children.

Nkirmpa's hopes and dreams are to become a large scale farmer, buy a bigger piece of land and build a plot. He is an energetic man who can do more if supported financially.

loans.use: to prepare for his wheat farming

loans.name: Meteini

texts.en:
Meteini, 39 years old, is married and has four children. He has been farming on his own piece of land for the last six years.

Meteini learned about KADET from the registered KADET groups. This will be his third loan, which he plans to use to prepare his land for wheat planting. Meteini hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to improve his children's living standards and education and for business expansion.

Meteini's dream is to prosper in the business of wheat farming. He is a hardworking man who is determined to achieve his set goals.

loans.use: to prepare his land for wheat planting

loans.name: Dennis

texts.en: Dennis is 32 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with 2 children. Dennis has been providing motorela or habal-habal services for 5 years. He has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy tools and utilities needed for the maintenance of his service. Dennis is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Dennis hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy tools and utilities needed to maintain his services

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase three cattle

loans.name: Ailyn

texts.en: Ailyn is 27 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. Ailyn has a pigpen that sells matured & grown pigs. She has had this business for two years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy animal feed for the pigs. Ailyn is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Ailyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy animal feed for the pigs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase eight lambs and fodder

loans.name: Phenny

texts.en:
Phenny is a married woman with five school-going children. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past 24 years, she has operated a poultry business, selling from home to her neighbors and restaurant operators. She faces the major challenge of seasonality in her business. Her major goal is to expand and earn more profits from her business.

With the KSHS 40,000, she wants to purchase broilers and chicks for her poultry business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase broilers and chicks for her poultry business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase three baby calves and fodder.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Evelyn has a retail shop that sells ready to wear clothes like t-shirt & blouses. She has had this business for 24 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy ready to wear or RTW clothes to sell.

Evelyn is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Evelyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy ready to wear (RTW) clothes to sell

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is 30 years old and married with five children. She comes from Kakamega, Kenya. She runs a tailoring services business. She has done this business for 10 years. She says the business is profitable and the major challenge she has is financial constraints.

She is borrowing a loan of KES 80,000 to buy materials to grow her business and serve more customers.  Her plans are to grow her business and start a tailoring school to empower the local people. She also hopes to give her children a good education to the university level. She describes herself as hardworking, patient and ambitious.

loans.use: to purchase more materials (fabric)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase 12 lambs and fodder

loans.name: Jamal's Group

texts.en:
Jamal, 42, is the treasurer of this group. She is bringing up two sons, both of whom are at school. In order to earn money to meet the family needs, her husband went to work in Russia. 

Two years ago with an initial investment of 15,000 soms, Jamal purchased 50 chickens and started to breed poultry. Selling the eggs and some chickens, she earns an additional 2000 soms per month. This profit made it possible to repair the house. With money received from the loan, Jamal wants to purchase feed for poultry. In the future, she wishes to build a house in Bishkek (capital of Kyrgyzstan).

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). loans.use: to purchase feed for poultry

loans.name: Wilgean

texts.en:
Wilgean is 23 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. 

Wilgean has a retail shop that sells ready-to-wear clothes (RTW), like t-shirts & blouses. She has had this business for 2 years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy additional ready-to-wear clothes to sell.  Wilgean is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Wilgean hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional ready-to-wear (RTW) clothes to sell

loans.name: Betty

texts.en: Betty currently operates a grocery shop selling rice, bread, oil, maize, etc. She  requested a loan from BRAC South Sudan to expand her business by purchasing more maize and rice for sale. She is 30 years old and married. Her husband is a farmer. She has one child who goes to school. She hopes that after receiving this loan her family will run more smoothly. She also wants to make more profit from her business.

loans.use: to purchase more maize and rice to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase one pregnant cow and fodder

loans.name: Rubilyn

texts.en:
Rubilyn is 32 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Rubilyn has a retail shop selling breads, biscuits, noodles & beverages. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy beverages, canned goods & snacks.

Rubilyn is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Rubilyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy beverages, canned goods & snacks

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past 10 years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of competition and seasonality from other clothes sellers in the area. Janet dreams of expanding and becoming a wholesale supplier of clothes in the future.

With the KSHS 20,000, she wants to purchase bundles of clothes for sale. She decided to join Yehu after witnessing other members benefiting from the program.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of clothes for sale.

loans.name: Fargana

texts.en: Fargana is a  27-year-old woman who is married with two children. Since her husband is unemployed, she has worked in the business of buying and selling cattle since 2009. Currently, she has two cows and one cattle. She has land that she cultivates for fattening her cattle. Now Fargana wants to expand her business, and since her children are grown up, she thinks that she will be able to look after more cattle with their help. Therefore, she is asking for 1,000 AZN in order to purchase more animals. Fargana expresses her gratitude for everyone who is supporting her and she promises to repay the loan on time.

loans.use: to purchase three cattle

loans.name: Jyparkul's Group

texts.en: Jyparkul is the leader of this group. She is 27 and married to a constructor. Together with her husband, she is bringing up two children, both of preschool age. Jyparkul works as a teacher at school, but her monthly salary doesn’t cover their daily needs, so Jyparkul started to breed livestock. She earns additional money for the family budget by reselling livestock at a higher price after being fattened. With money from this loan, she wants to increase her livestock. In the future, with the profits gained from this activity, she plans to repair her house. ====================================== Where Did This Loan Come From? loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Arcily

texts.en:
Arcily is 48 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. Arcily has a retail shop that sells fruit and green bananas. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy additional stock of fruit and vegetables.

Arcily is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Arcily hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of fruit and vegetables.

loans.name: Fanta

texts.en:
This is 38-year-old Fanta. She is married and has four children, ages 24, 16, 14 and 7 years. In 1995, she established her garri [cassava flakes], beans, groundnut [peanuts] and bennie seed [sesame seed] business. She began her business because she wants to fight poverty and also to help her husband run the home and adequately care for the children. Working 7 days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about 1,000,000 leones (SLL) every month from this business. 

Fanta would like a loan of 3,000,000 SLL. She requires a loan in order to buy more foodstuffs for her business. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately 250,000 SLL. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy garri, beans, groundnuts and bennie.

loans.name: Tamella

texts.en: Tamella is 54 years old. She has been living in a settlement for internally displaced people since 1996. She and her husband purchase and resell sheep as their business. She has four children. Tamella would like to request a loan of 1000 Azerbaijani manats in order to purchase additional sheep. This will increase her inventory and meet her customers' demands. She believes this will lead to greater revenue and, ultimately, greater profit for her family. In the future, Tamella would like to reinvest the earnings generated by this loan into her business to purchase additional cows and increase their income further.

loans.use: to purchase 8 lambs and fodder.

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Mary Grace is 30 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. Mary Grace has a retail shop that sells bananas, canned goods and snacks. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan of 5,000 Philippine pesos to buy canned goods, beverages and yellow bananas.

Mary Grace is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Mary Grace hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages and yellow bananas.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more jerrycans of alcohol to resell.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en: This borrower wants to purchase goats from the market. She will sell the meat in the market. She is requesting a loan to increase her business fund. She is 45 years old. She is married but her husband has died. She has two children. One is going to school.

loans.use: to purchase goats to start a business.

loans.name: Maludahan's Group

texts.en: Maludahan is the treasurer of this group. She is 55 and divorced. Maludahan is a resident of Kerben, a small village in the south of Kyrgyzstan. Four years ago, with an initial investment of 15,000 soms, she started to sell fruits and vegetables in the market. At the moment, her business runs well; she earns about 9,000 soms per month. Maludahan applied for the loan because she needs additional financial funds for purchasing a variety of fruits and vegetables. In the future, with the profits gained from her business, she plans to start repairing her house. Where Did This Loan Come From? This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Rashad

texts.en: Rashad has a little business selling foodstuffs such as rice, salt, confectioneries and beverages at the central market in Bilasuvar. An experienced entrepreneur, he has been selling for four years and has been successful offering good quality products for low prices. Rashad supports his family with his venture. He has requested a loan of 700 AZN so that he can purchase new inventory to stock. This is Rashad's first loan with AqroInvest CU. The loan will greatly improve Rashad’s income and his family's living standards.

loans.use: to purchase more food items to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy pepper, bowls and cotton in large quantity to sell

loans.name: Ibrahim's Group

texts.en: Ibrahim, 40, is a member of this group. He is a driver, and his wife works in the registry office. Together, they bring up two daughters and two sons. In order to earn additional money to meet the family needs, Ibrahim cultivates agricultural products and breeds cattle. At the moment, he has 20 farm animals and owns 0.3 hectares of land, where he wants to grow potatoes. He applied for the loan because he needs additional financial funds for purchasing mineral fertilizers. He wants to purchase 13 packs, and the price is 1,500 soms per pack. In the near future, he hopes to get a good harvest. Where Did This Loan Come From? loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase two cattle, two cows and fodder

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase one pregnant cow and two cattle

loans.name: Farkhad

texts.en: Farkhad is 45 years old. He is married with two children. He raises and sells cattle at the market. This is a very profitable business, especially during the summer season, the season of weddings and other celebrations. He has been in this business since 2004.  He usually sells dairy products such as milk and yoghurt to the local people and cattle in the livestock bazaar. His monthly profit is about 400 USD. He is requesting a loan to purchase more cows and feed for them. This is especially important to his family, because this business is their only financial source. Farkhad applied for a loan of 1,700 AZN to purchase more cattle and cows.

loans.use: to purchase four cattle, two pregnant cows and one milk cow

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy milk, mayonnaise, butter, sugar, etc. in large quantity to sell

loans.name: Shaymaa

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. She is 32 years old, married and has three children.

Shaymaa has been a tailor since 2002. She makes and repairs women’s clothing. She has a deep understanding of local consumer needs, a good reputation and she is well known in her area.
 
She is requesting a $2,000 loan to buy a generator and a tailoring machine. She is aiming to gain more profits so she can improve her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To buy a generator and a tailoring machine.

loans.name: Adjowa Dite Judith

texts.fr:
Mariée, Judith est  mère de 5 enfants, tous à sa charge. Elle habite chez ses parents avec ses enfants. Elle développe cette activité afin de pouvoir subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants. Judith est sur son 7e cycle de prêt et sollicite un montant de 500,000 FCFA.
Judith est vendeuse de condiments, des produits alimentaires, des céréales et autres au marché Mènontin, un marché de la capitale économique du Bénin. Son étalage se situe dans une zone très favorable à son activité. Ses clients sont constitués des usagers du marché et de ses environs. Elle effectue ses approvisionnements au moins 3 fois par semaine chez les grossistes du marché international du Bénin, Tokpa. Elle pourra donc tirer de revenus subséquents pouvant l'aider à assurer la survie de ses enfants et à offrir un confort plus agréable à sa famille. 
Son plus grand projet est d'avoir d'autres stands dans le marché afin de diversifier ses articles.
texts.en: Judith is married and the mother of five children, all still in her care. She lives at her parents’ home with her children. She launched this business in order to provide for her children. Judith is on her 7th loan and is seeking a new loan of 500,000 Francs. Judith sells condiments, food products, cereals, and so on, at the Mènontin market, one of the market of the economic capital of Benin. Her stand has a very advantageous location. Her clients are shoppers coming to the market and the nearby area. She stocks up at least three times a week from the wholesalers at Tokpa, the international market of Benin. This will then allow her to have important income in order to provide for her children and improve her family’s quality of life. Her biggest ambition is to have additional market stands in order to diversify her merchandise.

loans.use: to buy 25 bags of corn at 100 kg each

loans.name: Abdumalik

texts.en:
Abdumalik is a small business owner from Khujand, a city in the central part of Northern Tajikistan. He works to support his family by selling footwear at a busy central market called “Panjshanbeh”. Abdumalik has been in business for about eight years and makes around $200-$300 per month. Eventually he would like to open a second vending location to increase his sales and profits. Abdumalik has requested a loan of $1,500 USD to add to his working business capital. He has developed a good reputation and credit history with IMON International. We look forward to many more opportunities to assist Abdumalik with the success of his business. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy more shoes to sell

loans.name: Risper

texts.en:
Risper is a married woman who lives at a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past two years, she has operated a retail shop business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

With the 80,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase color paints for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase color paints for sale.

loans.name: Nozim

texts.en:
Nozim is 43 years old. He’s married with three children. His wife is a housekeeper who looks after their children. Nozim is the only breadwinner in the family and he is really hard working. He has a cafe where he sells national meals and foodstuffs. He has been in the business for almost 19 years. Nozim is trying to have fresh foodstuffs and tasty meals in his café and to ensure his clients have the option to eat, to have a rest and make the necessary purchases. His business is stable and that allows him to generate significant income and to ensure worthy living for his family. Now, Nozim’s children are growing and the expenses for them are rising too. Thus, Nozim wants to increase his business to earn more money to be able to cover the expenses of his children. With this purpose, he requests $3000 USD to expand his café. 


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to expand his cafe

loans.name: Shokirjon

texts.en:
Shokirjon is a 21-year-old married man who owns a small farm. Shokirjon has been running a business raising and selling cattle. He has six years of experience in this field. Since cattle raising and selling is a profitable business, Shokirjon has become a very successful businessman. He works very hard and spends all his time with his animals, cleaning them, feeding and pasturing. Now Shokirjon wants to expand his business and buy more cattle. So, he applied for a loan of $3,000 USD. Shokirjon thanks all lenders for their support.

To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Tohir

texts.en:
Tohir is a very responsible and optimistic person and he has two children and a wife to support. Tohir wishes to develop his business. This business consists of cattle-raising in his village because there is a very high demand for milk from villagers and especially from customers who come from enclosed towns. Tohir is helped by his wife. He is currently faced with many problems because his children are growing and, accordingly, their expenses are growing too. The only way to get out of this difficulty is to succeed in business, so we hope that the capabilities and services provided by IMON International will help him improve the business.

loans.use: to purchase more small cattle

loans.name: Mukadas

texts.en:
Mukadas is married with three children. She sells women's shoes at the central local market. Mukadas has had a rich experience working in the sphere of sales because she started as a salesperson. She decided to take a chance and launch her own enterprise six years ago and has enjoyed every second of being self-employed. Mukadas is hoping to purchase a vending kiosk to run her business more efficiently and facilitate her sales. Mukadas is very responsible and perseverant. We believe her strategic planning and prudence will help her achieve her business goals as well as her individual goals in life.

loans.use: To purchase shoes to sell

loans.name: Maria Lisy

texts.es:
La Señora Maria Lisy tiene 39 años de edad, esta casada, vive en  la ciudad de Encarnacion.
Ella se dedica a la venta de joyas desde hace ya unos años. Es muy conocida en el barrio por las joyas que trae para la venta. Ella es muy buena mujer. Se define como una mujer trabajadora y luchadora. Cuenta que todo lo que hace es a miras hacia un futuro mejor.
Ella sueña con algún día poder abrir una joyería propia donde pueda ofrecer una gran variedad de joyas. Esta muy orgullosa de lo que hace, ya que gracias a su trabajo ha podido salir adelante y solventrar los gastos de la casa.
Ella solicita el credito para la compra de mas joyas, como ser pulseras, cadenas anillos y demás, para tener mas variedad de productos. Desde ya agradece a la Fundación por la oportunidad.
texts.en:
Maria Lisy is 39 years old, married, and lives in the city of Encarnación.  She has been selling jewelry for some years.  She is very well known in her neighborhood for the jewelry that she sells.  She is a very good woman and describes herself as a hard-working and tenacious woman.  She tells us that everything she does is with a view to creating a better future for herself.

Maria Lisy dreams that some day she will be able to open her own jewelry store where she will sell a wide range of jewelry.  She is very proud of what she does since, thanks to her work, she has been able to get ahead in life and cover her household expenses.

Maria Lisy is requesting a loan to buy more jewelry such as bracelets, chains, rings, etc., so that she can offer a wider range of products.  She is grateful to Fundación Paraguaya for the opportunity they are giving her.

loans.use: to buy jewelry to sell such as chains, bracelets, rings, etc.

loans.name: Michael's Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are staff members of the Sierra Leone Port Authority from Makeni. They have come to SMT/Kiva lenders in order to seek a Salary Loan of SLL 3,050,000.00 to meet their immediate financial challenges. At the end of each month, they will repay their Kiva loan, using their monthly salaries.  

Michael is the leader of this group of two. Born in Freetown, the 26-year-old is single with no children.  Michael has been working for this organization for four years now. He has requested a loan of SLL 2,300,000 in order to buy house-building materials – cements, zincs, etc for the construction of a house.

loans.use: to buy house-building materials like cement, zinc, etc

loans.name: Manon

texts.en:
Manon is a 45-year-old farmer who lives with his family, consisting of four children and his wife. He has two milk cows and sells dairy products to the local and capital traders. Manon has 20 years of experience raising cattle and selling dairy products. The milk products are in very high demand in his village. Manon’s orders for these products are very high but the milk his cows give is not enough for traders and he decided to apply for $2,000 USD to purchase an additional cow and fodder. Manon is very grateful to everyone who is helping him to improve his living with this loan.

loans.use: to purchase an additional cow and fodder

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice, 33, is a very hard-working woman who practices mixed farming in Olokurto-Narok, Kenya. She has been farming for over five years. She is married and has five children.

She is applying for her first loan, which she plans to use to buy farm supplies. She intends to use the additional income from the proceeds of this loan to buy cattle for fattening and to pay her children's school fees. 

She hopes to develop her business and to be financially stable in the future.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase sacks of coconuts and charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to employ more people.

loans.name: Onabibi

texts.en:
Onabibi is very hardworking woman who tries to make money for her family by working hard everyday. About six years ago, she decided to start raising and selling animals. This allows her to pay for the education of her three children, who have high hopes for the future. She raises young cattle and later sells them at the markets. She prepares them to be ready to eat for the eating pleasure of the people in her country. Since Onabibi aspires for a great future, she decided to expand her businesses with the sole purpose of improving her family's living conditions and to help pay for her children's education so that they can one day become good citizens in society. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International: Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. loans.use: to purchase small cattle.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad, 50, is a married father of three children who lives with his family in Qana. For 20 years, he has worked raising bees, a business he took from his father, and most of his clients are loyal as they dealt with his father and now come to him for the good quality of honey they serve.

Mohamad provides his customers with summer honey, which he considers the best, unlike others who serve spring honey. He is an expert in his domain and a man with a good reputation. He seeks perfection in his business, which is why he's requesting his first loan from Al Majmoua in order to buy necessary tools and medicines for his business. Mohamad also plans to help his son to continue building his house as much as he can.

loans.use: to buy necessary tools and medicines for his business.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last eighteen years. He is 41 years old and married to Elizabeth.  

He was introduced to KADET by one of their field officers and this will be his second loan. He paid his previous loan of 16,000 KES well and in good time.  He plans to use this new loan to buy potato seeds for planting.

In the future, John hopes to become a leading farmer in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: to buy more potato seeds for planting.

loans.name: Sobir

texts.en:
Sobir is a very experienced taxi driver who supports himself and his family by driving his taxi around the city of Gafurov, Tajikistan. He has been providing transportation services for over 25 years and is still going strong. Sobir currently drives a German-made car, an Opel, one of the most popular car brands in Tajikistan. His monthly income is typically around $300. Sobir would like to continue providing reliable transportation and has requested a loan of $2000 USD to have some work done on his car. We are happy for this opportunity to help Sobir as he works hard to make a living.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International: Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi.
