To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for a thorough car repair.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys has operated her clothes shop in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last five years, selling both new and used clothes. She is 54 and the single mother of one child.

She was introduced to KADET by a field officer and this will be her first loan. She plans to use the loan to buy clothes in bulk for resale.

In the future, Gladys hopes to grow her shop and open a big boutique.

loans.use: to buy clothes in bulk for resale.

loans.name: Haydar

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 44 years old, married and has five children. Haydar has owned a food market since 2000, selling soft drinks, juices, cheese and dairy products. He has a deep understanding of local consumer needs. His market is situated in a crowded area so there are a good number of customers passing by.
Haydar is requesting a $2,400 loan to buy two refrigerators, a generator and more foodstuff for his market. He is aiming to earn more profits so he can improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy two refrigerators, a generator and more foodstuff for his market.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more retail goods for resale.

loans.name: Loise

texts.en:
Loise, 37, has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 8 years. She is married to James and they have three school-going children.  

Loise was introduced to KADET by one of their field officers and this will be her second loan. She repaid her previous loan of 10,000 KES well and in good time. She plans to use this loan to buy potato seeds for planting.

In the future, she hopes to become a leading farmer in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: to buy potato seeds for planting.

loans.name: Caacupe Group

texts.es:
La formación del presente comité se inició gracias a la señora María, ya que ella había oído hablar de programa de mujeres emprendedoras, y quedo entusiasmada con la idea, así que organizo a sus amigas y vecinas y de allí surgió el comité. Ellas se encuentran en el séptimo ciclo, con 12 integrantes.
La Sra. Maria se dedica a la venta de comida desde hace muchos años. Gracias a eso ha logrado formar una grupo de clientes bien definido. Ella manifiesta que es muy buena cocinera, y que su comida gusta mucho, por lo que tiene mucha demanda.
La Cliente se define como una mujer muy trabajadora y luchadora. Ella desea alguna día tener un lugar mas amplio donde poder ofrecer sus alimentos. Ella solicita el credito para la compra de los insumos para la elaboración de sus alimentos, como ser carnes, huevos, condimentos y demás.
texts.en:
The formation of this committee began thanks to Señora María. She had heard of an entrepreneurial women’s program and was enthusiastic about the idea. So she organized her friends and neighbors and there the committee emerged.

Señora María has made a living selling food for many years. Thanks to that she has been able to establish a very defined group of customers. She states that she is a very good cook and that her food is very tasty, which is why it is in high demand. 

The client defines herself as a hardworking woman and a fighter. She hopes one day to have a bigger location where she would be able to offer her food. She is requesting a loan to buy supplies for making her food such as meat, eggs and seasonings, among others.

loans.use: to buy meat, seasonings, eggs and other supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat oil, sacks of beans and detergents for resale.

loans.name: Toufic

texts.en:
Toufic, 21, is a single man who has been working in the mobile phone sector for five years. He started working early because he had to contribute to his family's income to cover part of their expenses, which he still does.

Toufic is requesting his third loan from Al Majmoua to use as capital for mobile phones and accessories for the summer season, since many tourists visit his region and he has to be ready for their needs. He has a good reputation and provides the best customer service, starting with the peaceful smile he draws on his customers faces from the moment they enter his shop.

Toufic is a good-standing borrower. He hopes to expand his business and open a new branch in the future.

loans.use: to capitalize his mobile phone business.

loans.name: Zaman

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 36 years old, married and has five children. Zaman has owned a generator since 2003; he distributes power lines for houses. He has more than eight years of experience, has a good reputation and is well known in his area.
Zaman is requesting a $2,400 loan to rebuild the soundproof room for his generator. He is aiming to earn more profits so he can improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to rebuild the soundproof room for his generator.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Kawthar

texts.en: Kawthar is a 40-year-old single lady. Ten years ago, she was able to start her own small home-based business. Her business is basically selling home products such as kitchen tools and home decoration pieces. Now Kawthar has applied for a loan to add new products to increase variety so she can open a home supplies store in the near future.

loans.use: to buy more types of home products for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase another motorcycle for her transport business.

loans.name: Dionicio Franco

texts.es:
El Sr. Dionicio esta casado, tiene dos hijos, todos en edad escolar. Con la ayuda de su esposa  están  saliendo adelante con mucho sacrificio y esfuerzo.
Él se dedica a la venta de cubiertos de forma ambulante por la zona de Ciudad del Este. Manifiesta que las ventas están cada vez más en ascenso, generándole un buen ingreso. Hoy día él es un microempresario exitoso con una clientela fiel y numerosa, debido a su amabilidad
El se define como una persona responsable y honesta en sus compromisos, dice que todo lo que hace es para el bien de su familia, para velar por una mejor calidad de vida para ellos.
El solicita el credito para la compra de mas cubiertos para después venderlos.
texts.en:
Dionicio is married and has 2 school-aged children.  With the help of his wife he is getting ahead with a lot of sacrifice and effort.  He has a business selling silverware on the streets in a neighborhood of Ciudad del Este.  He says that his sales are growing over time, generating a good income.  Now he is a successful businessman who, because of his pleasant personality, has a large number of  regular customers. 

He defines himself as a person who is responsible and honest in his commitments.  He says that everything he does is for his family's well-being, so that he can ensure a better quality of life for them.

He requests a loan to buy more silverware to later sell.

loans.use: to buy silverware to later sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy beans and maize for resale.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali, 45, is a married father of six who has been working in the agriculture sector since he was 25. He is well known in the region and is specialized in raising cattle and selling them to dairy products factories.

Ali is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua for the first time in order to buy necessary food and medicine for his cattle. He also plans to build an extra room in his house to give extra space to his children.

Ali gives priority to his family's safety and needs, working hard to be ready for any request they have. He hopes to increase his number of cattle in the future, which will definitely lead to an increase in income.

loans.use: to buy necessary food and medicine for his cattle.

loans.name: Ezra

texts.en: Ezra, 38, is a married man with four children who owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. He has been in the coffee business for fifteen years and having started with 100,000 shillings, he now has 10,000,000 shillings in working capital. His hardship is prolonged in the rainy season, as it affects the drying period. His dream is to own a coffee store so as to export to other countries. Ezra needs the loan to buy coffee for resale.

loans.use: to buy coffee for resale.

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi is a married woman with three children, two of whom attend school while one is still too young. She owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past four years, she has operated a charcoal and firewood selling business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business, as during rainy season the availability of charcoal is lower than the demand. She dreams of becoming the leading supplier of charcoal in the future.

With the 20,000 Kshs loan, she plans to purchase sacks of charcoal and bundles of firewood for sale. Mwanamisi joined Yehu because of its favorable loaning procedures.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal and bundles of firewood for resale.

loans.name: Fanahasi

texts.en: Fanahasi, 28, is a married man with two children who rents a house in Kasese, Uganda. He is involved in a number of activities such as a retail shop, farming and he has also been a government employee for eight years. His hardship is limited funds to help him maintain his businesses and his dream is to own a wholesale business and to educate his children. Fanahasi needs the loan facility to buy sugar and soap for resale.

loans.use: to buy sugar and soap for resale.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles, 45, is married with six children and lives in a semi-permanent house in Kammwenge, Uganda. His dream is to have a permanent house and to educate his children.

Charles has been selling maize, as well as farming, for the past 20 years. He likes his business because he earns a living from it and hopes to expand it more, despite the challenge of limited funds to meet the increasing demand from his customers. Charles needs the loan facility to buy maize for resale.

loans.use: to buy maize for resale.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 59-year-old married man and the father of two children. He has been working as a butcher for 25 years and enjoys his work. Ali is well known in the region for his good reputation, hardworking personality and devotion to his family.
To improve his business, Ali is requesting a loan from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua, for the second time. He will use the loan to buy a new refrigerator to keep his meat in, plus a new meat-mincing machine to provide customers with good quality products. He might also hire an employee to help in responding to customers' needs faster. His previous loan had a good impact on both his social and financial situations. Ali might also expand his business by starting a snack area in his shop, which might lead to a small restaurant in the future.

loans.use: to buy a new refrigerator and a machine to mince meat.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is a 49-year-old married man who has 12 children. He lives in a permanent house in Kamwenge, Uganda.
Charles has been in the cattle business for 15 years. Despite challenges in the increasing prices of cattle, he is happy with his business as he has been able to pay school fees for his children, Charles needs this loan facility to buy cattle for resale. His dream is to buy plots of land and educate his children to higher levels.

loans.use: to buy cattle for resale.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a businesswoman. She wants to buy goods for her grocery shop such as sugar, rice, salt, oil, etc. Joyce wants to improve her business with this loan.
Joyce is 28 years old, married and has two children, both of whom go to school. Her husband also help her in the business.

loans.use: to buy goods for her grocery shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more stocks of fish.

loans.name: Nueva Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El comité se inició gracias a la iniciativa de la señora Blanca, quien se animó a trabajar en grupo. Luego de conocer el programa de la Fundación logro animar a sus vecinas y amigas, de donde surgió el comité. El grupo se define como muy responsable y cumplidor con sus obligaciones. Todas las miembros son muy trabajadoras y solidarias entre si.
La Sra. Lilian se dedica a la venta de cosméticos, cuenta que su negocio le ha generado buenos ingresos, por lo cual le gustaría poder seguir con el. Por medio de este trabajo ha podido darse a conocer por todo el barrio.
Ella solicita el credito para la compra de mas variedades de cosméticos con lo que podra satisfacer la demanda que tiene, ya que al hacerse conocida por el barrio mas gente viene a hacerle pedidos.
texts.en:
This group was started thanks to the initiative of Blanca, who motivated them to work together as a group.  After learning about the program of the  Fundación, she encouraged her friends and neighbors to join, and thus this commercial bank was formed.  This group is characterized as being very responsible and effective in making its payments.  All of the members are very hardworking and support each other.

Lilian has a business selling cosmetics.  She says that her business has generated good income, and so she would like to continue with it.  Through this work she has become well-known in the neighborhood.

Lilian requests a loan to buy a greater variety of cosmetics so that she can satisfy the demand that she has, because as she has become well-known in the neighborhood, more people come to make orders with her.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics to later sell

loans.name: Specioza

texts.en:
Specioza is a 36-year-old married woman with two children. She lives in her own house in Kamwenge, Uganda.
Specioza has been operating a bar for three years now and and this has helped her to provide for her family as she is the sole provider. She has challenges in breakage of bottles that cause her losses. Her business dream is to own a big bar. Specioza is requesting a loan to buy crates of beers for resale. Her dream is to ensure she secures enough savings to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy crates of beer for resale.

loans.name: Fredrick

texts.en:
Fredrick is a 31-year-old married man with three children. He lives in a permanent house in Kamwenge, Uganda.
Fredrick has been in the food sales business for the past three years. He faces the challenge of limited funds to meet increasing demand. His business dream is to own a food store. Fredrick intends to use this loan facility to buy maize for resale. His family dream is to set up an income-generating activity for the family and to educate his children.

loans.use: to buy maize for resale.

loans.name: Bigoro Tutungukye Group

texts.en:
Bwambale is a 34-year-old married man with four children. He lives in a permanent house in Kamwenge, Uganda. Bwambale has been operating a drug shop for two years. The business has been profitable and has facilitated him in paying school fees for his children. He faces the challenge of limited capital to buy the required drugs for most patients. Bwambale's dream is to own a pharmacy. 

Bwambale is a member of a group and, as policy, each member guarantees the others in acquiring credit facilities. Bwambale needs the loan to buy drugs for resale.

loans.use: to buy drugs for resale.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a 40-year-old single mother of four children. She owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. Mary has been selling clothes for 20 years. She started her business with 500,000 Shillings and now has 1,500,000 Shillings as her working capital. Her main challenge is bad debtors. Mary's vision is for a bigger shop and to educate her children. She intends to use this loan facility to buy clothes for resale.

loans.use: to buy clothes for resale.

loans.name: Amos

texts.en:
Amos is a 32-year-old married man with three children. He lives in a rented house in Fort Portal, Uganda. His dream is to educate his children to attain degrees as a minimum qualification.
Amos operates a retail shop and a motorcycle transport business. He says both businesses would be flourishing if he had enough capital. His desire is to own five motorcycles for the passenger transport business. Amos is requesting this loan facility to buy a motorcycle for his transport business.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Zibambele Group

texts.en:
Nokuthula is 26 years old, single and has four children between the ages of one and nine, three of whom attend school. Nokuthula runs a livestock business in Kwa Zulu Nata in Mandini, South Africa. In the photo she is pictured raising her hand.
Nokuthula has been in this business for two years and sells livestock chickens from her home. She also receives income from the goverment's child support grant. Nokuthula has requested this loan to buy livestock chickens through WDB and Kiva. She says that the extra income from the loan will help her improve her life. In the future she would like to own a wholesale business.
Nokuthula thanks WDB and Kiva for helping her, because she is not working.

loans.use: to buy livestock chickens.

loans.name: Peluce

texts.en: Peluce is a 49-year-old widow with eight children. She owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. She has been a landlady for ten years and got her initial capital from selling sugar cane. Her main challenge is delayed rent payment. Her vision is to own another commercial (rental) house and to educate her family. Peluce is requesting the loan facility to renovate her commercial house.

loans.use: to renovate her commercial (rental) house.

loans.name: Bëgg Cheikh Moustapha Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Bëgg Cheikh Moustapha du Banc Villageois Sop Sokhna Awa Balla est créé depuis le 21 septembre 2010, il est composé de neuf femmes qui sont unies par affinité et par des liens de voisinage elles s'activent dans le petit commerce.


Madame Mame Diarra la responsable est âgée de 36 ans, elle est mariée avec trois enfants en charge; elle mène une activité de petit commerce et a une bonne expérience. Elle est à droite debout à l'extrême sur la photo habillée en robe multicolore.


Elle achéte ses pagnes, draps et colliers dans une grande ville proche et revend dans son quartier et au marché du village.



Son prêt lui servira à acheter plus de marchandises pour satisfaire la clientèle mais aussi pour se faire beaucoup de revenus.


Elle souhaite avec les bénéfices attendus soutenir son mari dans la gestion des dépenses de la famille en nourriture et santé et renforcer son épargne.
texts.en: The solidarity group Bëgg Cheikh Moustapha, belonging to the Banc Villageois Sop Sokhna Awa Balla, was created on September 21, 2010. It is composed of nine women who are united by ties of friendship and neighborhood. They are active in small trade. Mrs Mame Diarra, the president of the group, is 36 years old, married and the mother of three children, all in her care. She is a small merchant with good experience. She is the first person standing at the right-hand side of the photo and wearing a multicolored dress. She buys pagnes (colored West African cloths), linen and necklaces in a nearby large city and resells them in her neighborhood and at the village market. She will use her loan to buy more goods to satisfy her customers and also to earn more money. Thanks to the expected profit, she wants to support her husband with household expenditures (food and healthcare) and increase her savings.

loans.use: to buy pagnes, linen and necklaces for resale.

loans.name: Kabayirwe

texts.en: Kabayirwe is a 49-year-old married woman with seven children. She owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. Kabayirwe has been selling soda for two years. She got the initial capital to start her current business by farming. She has challenges in terms of limited funds to supply her increasing customer base. Her dream is to own a soda depot. Kabayirwe is requesting this loan facility to buy soda for resale.

loans.use: to buy soda for resale.

loans.name: Justus

texts.en: Justus, 40, is a married man with three children living in a rented house in Fort Portal, Uganda. He longs to build his own house. He has been distilling local brew for five years which has allowed him to provide for his family, since he is the sole provider. He faces the challenge of price fluctuation and his dream is to have his own banana plantation so as to minimize the cost of production.

loans.use: to buy land to plant bananas.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is married with four children aged 5 to 15. She sells fish, a business she has been operating for the last ten years. She has managed to hire five employees. Beatrice intends to use her loan to increase her stock of fish. She hopes to expand her business and start selling fish all over the country. Beatrice describes herself as confident and social.

loans.use: to increase her stock of fish for resale.

loans.name: Sop Sokhna Absa Diakhate Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Sop Sokhna Absa est composé de huit femmes qui habitent le même quartier et qui sont unies par des liens de parenté et de voisinage, elles ont longtemps travaillé ensemble dans le même groupement; il est créé depuis le 21 septembre 2010.


La responsable madame Astou est âgée de 39 ans, mariée elle est mère de trois enfants et a en charge sa petite sœur; elle mène une activité de produits divers et a son actif un réfrigérateur qui lui permet de vendre de la glace et du jus de fruits.Sur la photo elle est debout tout à fait à droite habillée en camisole rose bleu.



Elle achète ses produits(sucre, café, ail, oignons, poivre, piment....)  au marché central du village et revend dans son quartier.



Astou souhaite avec son prêt renforcer son activité en ayant un bon stock de bissap, pain de singe et de sucre pour ainsi se faire plus de revenus.

Ses bénéfices obtenus lui servent à améliorer le bien être de sa famille et de renforcer son épargne.
texts.en:
The Sop Sokhna Absa support group is made up of eight women who live in the same neighborhood and who are united by familial and neighborhood connections. They have been working together for a long time; the group was created on September 21, 2010. 
The leader, Mrs. Astou, is a 39-year-old married mother of three who also takes care of her little sister. She sells diverse products and has a refrigerator that allows her to sell ice cream and fruit juice. In the photo, she is the one standing to the far right dressed in pink and blue.
She buys her products (sugar, coffee, garlic, onions, peppers, spices, …) at the village’s central market and sells it in her neighborhood.
Astou wishes to use her loan to grow her business by having a good stock of hibiscus flowers, baobab tree fruit, and sugar to be able to earn more money.
The profits will help her to improve her family’s well being and to increase her savings.

loans.use: to buy food goods to be sold

loans.name: Yenis

texts.es: Yenis  de 45 años es la propietaria  de una refresquerìa, ubicada en la ciudad de Cartagena donde vive con su cónyuge y sus dos hijos en las edades de 16 y 22 años.  Yenis recibió toda su experiencia de su cónyuge, quien inició la refresquería y posteriormente cuando estuvo listo, creó otro negocio y se lo dejó a ella, para favorecer el bienestar del hogar común incrementando así sus ingresos familiares.  Durante los fines de semana el negocio genera un gran movimiento comercial y por eso su esposo la apoya durante estos días, porque tienen el sueño de fortalecerlo de abrir dos puntos de venta más, generando con esto puestos de trabajo.  Su credikiva es el primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con él comprará mesas, sillas plásticas y apetitosos productos de cafetería, así como materias primas, para iniciar con un nuevo punto comercial. Su mayor fortaleza es la experiencia en el mercado, el apoyo de su familia, y el lugar donde se instalarán que es bien conocido, mientras esto ocurre en su Refresquería , maneja una razón corriente de 1,75 y una buena rentabilidad que le permite la sostenibilidad de su nueva inversión.
texts.en:
Yenis is 45 years old and the owner of a business located in the city of Cartagena where she lives with her partner and her two children who are 16 and 22 years old. 

Yenis received all of her experience from her partner who started the snack shop. Later when he was ready he started another business and left the snack shop to her to help with the combined wellbeing of the home and increase the family income. On the weekends the business has a lot of commercial activity so her husband helps her on those days. Their dream is to strengthen the business and open two more locations, which would generate jobs. 

This is the first loan she has taken out with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will buy tables, plastic chairs and tasty café products as well as raw materials to start a new commercial location. Her biggest strengths are her experience in the market, the support of her family and the location of the business which is well known. Meanwhile, in her store she is running a current ratio of 1.75 and enjoys good profitability which makes her new investment sustainable.

loans.use: to buy tables, plastic chairs and café products as well as raw materials.

loans.name: Kazem

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 45 years old, married and has seven children. In 2006, K. opened a greengrocery shop, where he sells fruits and vegetables. He has a deep understanding of local consumer needs. K.'s store is situated in a crowded area so there are a good number of customers passing by.
K. is requesting a $1,200 loan to pay the annual rent for his store. He is aiming to earn more profits to improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent for his store.

loans.name: Sharifa

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. She is 38 years old, married and has four children.
Sharifa has run a food market since 2008 selling soft drinks, juices, cheese and dairy products. She has a deep understanding of local consumer needs. Her market is situated in a crowded area so there are a good number of customers passing by. She is requesting a $1800 loan to buy an air conditioner, a generator and more foodstuffs for her market. She is aiming to earn more profits so she can improve her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy an air conditioner, a generator and more foodstuffs for her market.

loans.name: Alpha Group

texts.en: Mavis, 43, is a widow with three children aged between 15 and 24, one of whom attends school. She runs a retail business in Kwa Zulu Natal of Mandini in South Africa. In the photo, she is pictured raising her hand. She has been in this business for three years, selling red meet and spices. She also receives income from the government via a child support grant. She requested this loan from WDB and Kiva to buy red meat and chicken heads and feet. Mavis says that the extra income from this loan will help her to build a house for her family and to send her child to tertiary level.

loans.use: to buy red meat and chicken heads and feet for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase more jerrycans of milk for resale.

loans.name: Virgen Del Rosario Group

texts.es:
El contacto para el inicio del presente comité fue la señora Aidee quién  invito y organizo a sus amigas para formar parte del programa Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras.Actualmente el comité tiene 16 integrantes, todas ellas trabajan de forma solidaria, en un ambiente de cooperación y respeto.
La sra. Aidee esta casada hace 11 años con el señor Juan, tienen dos hijos menores que van a la primaria.  la señora Aiide se dedica a la venta de ropas de todo tipo. Ella sueñan con abrir una mercería logrando de esa manera construir para su casa y  brindar lo mejor a sus hijos en educación, salud, osio, vestimenta.
Ella solicita el credito para la compra de prendas de la temporada. Sabe que con mayor variedad de ropas podrá atraer a mas clientes.
texts.en:
The person who was the group contact when this committee started was Sra. Aidee. She invited and organized her friends in order to join the Committee of Women Entrepreneurs Program. The committee has 16 members, all of whom work in a supportive manner and in a spirit of cooperation and respect.

Sra. Aidee has been married 11 years to Sr. Juan. They have two young children who attend elementary school. Sra. Aidee sells all types of clothing. She dreams of opening a variety store, which is why she has a built a house. As a result, she will be able to provide the best for her children in terms of education, health care, activities, and clothes.

Aidee is requesting a loan to buy seasonal clothing. She knows that a large variety of clothing will attract more customers.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal clothing such as coats, scarves, and other items.

loans.name: Susana

texts.es: Doña Susana es una mujer muy trabajadora que vive en la ciudad de Cartagena, siempre le ha gustado ser independiente y gozar de mucha autonomía para decidir, eso es justamente lo que tener un negocio le ha significado. Porque a la edad de 74 años, siendo  una mujer casada con 7 hijos en las edades de 34 a 49 años, por su propia decisión se mantiene activa, trabajando y generando ingresos y mucha alegría por ello.  Ella hace mucho tiempo se dedicaba a la preparación y venta de alimentos en Maicao un Municipio fronterizo de Venezuela, donde la actividad mercantil que se desarrolla, por su ubicación geográfica es autóctona de esta región, por eso ella la asumió y se involucró en la venta de mercancías que realizaba a clientes propietarios de tenderetes y pequeños puntos comerciales en las hermosas playas de Bocagrande y aun en el mercado de Bazurto en la ciudad heroica de Colombia.  En la actualidad vende a otro tipo de clientela, en su barrio y en sectores aledaños,  bolsos, calzado, cobijas, a créditos pactados de acuerdo a las posibilidades de sus clientes. Doña Susana está vinculada a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo hace 6 años  en los cuales recibió 14 créditos, organización con la cual logró la ampliación de su capital de trabajo y su crecimiento personal. Su meta más adelante es ubicar su negocio en un espacio aparte pero en su propia vivienda, para hacerlo más atractivo a toda su comunidad. Con su credikiva comprará bolsos chancletas, blusas y sandalias, para responder a su clientela quienes ya la han encargado y desea ser oportuna.
texts.en:
Doña Susana is a hardworking woman who lives in the city of Cartagena. She has always enjoyed being independent and making her own decisions. This is why having a business has significant meaning. Susana is 74 years old and a married woman with seven children between the ages of 34 and 49. She has chosen to stay active through working and generating income because it gives her much joy. Susana spends a great deal of time preparing and selling food in Maicao, a municipality along the border with Venezuela where commercial activity has developed. Since this area is in an indigenous region, she took some of the goods produced by her customers who own small retail outlets along the beautiful beaches of Bocagrande and at the market in the heroic Colombian city of Bazurto. She currently sells this merchandise to her other customers in her neighborhood and the surrounding areas. These items include bags, shoes, and blankets. The loans she has agreed to take out have been based on potential orders from her customers.

Doña Susana has been with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo for six years and has received 14 loans. As a result of working with the organization, she has been able increase her operating capital and experience personal growth. Her goal later on is to relocate her business into a space away from her home so that it will be more attractive to the entire community. With this Kiva loan, she will buy bags, slippers, blouses, and sandals so that she can respond to her customers in a timely manner since they have already placed their orders.

loans.use: to purchase bags, slippers, blouses, and sandals.

loans.name: Fatima De La Concepcion

texts.es: Fátima De La Concepción tiene 43 años, su actividad es la venta de mercadería en general y pulpería. Este negocio lo inicio hace 8 años, con mucho sacrificio ha salido adelante, pues no ha sido fácil mantener este negocio. La mayoría de sus clientes llegan a comprar la amplia variedad de productos que ofrece, tiene que levantarse temprano todos los días para comenzar su labor. El crédito que solicita es para la compra de golosinas, granos básicos, jugos, leche, fósforos, sal y cosas para el hogar.
texts.en:
Fátima De La Concepción is 43 years old. She sells general merchandise and has a store. Fátima started this business eight years ago with great sacrifice so that she could get ahead. However, it has not been easy to maintain her business. Most of her customers come to buy the expanding variety of products she offers. She has to wake up early every day in order to start her work.

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy candy, basic grains, juices, milk, matches, salt, and household items.

loans.use: to purchase candy, basic grains, juices, milk, matches, salt, and household items.

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.es:
El Sr.Ricardo está casado con la Sra. Mirdia hace varios años. Tienen dos hijos menores que dependen de ellos. 
Don Ricardo trabaja en compra-venta  de artículos reciclados, se inició con un pequeño capital que tenía ahorrado de otro trabajo que  realizaba.Gracias al trabajo emprendido educan a sus hijos y compran todas las necesidades de su hogar.Él se define como una persona muy responsable y honesta en sus compromisos.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de aluminio, cobre, plásticos y otros.Como antecedente dentro de la Fundación ya posee créditos, con los cuales cumplió satisfactoriamente.
texts.en:
Sr. Ricardo has been married to Sra. Mirdia for several years.  They have two young children who are dependent on them.

Don Ricardo buys and sells recyclable materials.  He started with a little bit of capital that he saved up from another job he had.  Thanks to his work, he has been able to provide his children with an education and buy necessities for their home.  Ricardo is considered to be a responsible person who is honest in his commitments.  

He is requesting a loan to buy aluminum, copper, plastics, and other materials.  Ricardo has had previous loans with Fundación Paraguaya that were fully repaid.

loans.use: to purchase aluminum, copper, plastics, and other materials.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 45 years old, married, and has four children. Three of her children are attending school.
Mary is a businesswoman. She is requesting a loan to meet the expense of housing repairs.

loans.use: to pay for housing repairs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase building materials to complete the construction of a room in his house.
